MobileDesc:

On Oct 6-7, the global women's leadership and lifestyle event is back with the most powerful roster of speakers, programming, attendees and partners yet. In its 4th year, S.H.E. Summit is an unforgettable, once-a-year experience designed to:

MobileDesc: An award-winning historian and political correspondent, Robin Wright has reported from more than 140 countries on six continents for The Washington Post, The Los Angeles Times, The New York Times Magazine, amongst others, and is a regular contributor to The New Yorker. Her latest book is Rock the Casbah: Rage and Rebellion Across the Islamic World. She joins Professor Buultjens for this special World Politics event to discuss whether the Middle East is collapsing and what the implications for Israel are. Don't miss what's sure to be an enlightening evening.
ShortDesc: An award-winning historian and political correspondent, Robin Wright has reported from more than 140 countries on six continents for The Washington Post, The Los Angeles Times, The New York Times Magazine, amongst others, and is a regular contributor to The New Yorker.
Title: Making Sense of the Middle East: Robin Wright in Conversation with Ralph Buultjens

MobileDesc:
In 2009, as outgoing President George W. Bush briefed President-elect Barack Obama about the ongoing wars and plummeting economy he’d soon inherit, the Bush team revealed a late-breaking threat: US intelligence sources believed that an Al Qaeda-linked group was planning to attack the National Mall during the upcoming inaugural festivities. Noted political science professor and author Martha Joynt Kumar chronicles the gripping inside story of one of history’s most tenuous transfers of power.

Martha Joynt Kumar will be signing copies of Before the Oath: How Bush and Obama Managed a Transfer of Power following the event.
ShortDesc: In 2009, as outgoing President George W. Bush briefed President-elect Barack Obama about the ongoing wars and plummeting economy he’d soon inherit, the Bush team revealed a late-breaking threat.
Title: Before the Oath: How Bush and Obama Managed a Transfer of Power

MobileDesc: Tony Martin and Cyd Charisse were married for over 60 years. Martin was a pop singer, with hit records beginning in the 1930s. Charisse was a classically trained dancer who performed with the Ballets Russes before being hired by Columbia in 1943 to perform ballet sequences in Something to Shout About. Marc Courtade traces the careers of this power couple from their minor roles to their major star turns in the 1950s.
ShortDesc: Tony Martin and Cyd Charisse were married for over 60 years.
Title: On Tony Martin and Cyd Charisse

ShortDesc: Women face a number of challenges during their parenting years.
Title: Motherhood and Your Professional Identity: Career Planning Strategies for Your Parenting Years

ShortDesc: While many kids are lucky enough to become best of friends with their sibling, it is normal for siblings to fight, at least some of the time.
Title: Sibling Rivalry: How to Keep the Peace at Home

MobileDesc: We’re beyond excited to be hosting a #FierceReads event! Join us for YA conversation and a panel of devastatingly good writers, including Leigh Bardugo (Six of Crows), Leila Sales (Tonight the Streets Are Ours), Emma Mills (First & Then) and Josephine Agnelini (Firewalker).
ShortDesc: We’re beyond excited to be hosting a #FierceReads event!
Title: YA Lit at 92Y: Fierce Reads Tour

MobileDesc:
T. J. English, author of Paddy Whacked, gives a gripping overview of Celtic gangster Whitey Bulger, a notorious Boston character who was often romanticized as a Robin Hood-esque thief and protector.

T. J. English will be signing copies of Where the Bodies Were Buried: Whitey Bulger and the World That Made Him following the event.
ShortDesc: T. J. English, author of Paddy Whacked, gives a gripping overview of Celtic gangster Whitey Bulger, a notorious Boston character who was often romanticized as a Robin Hood-esque thief and protector.
Title: Whitey Bulger and the World that Made Him

MobileDesc: Oscar Hammerstein had a wildly successful career before Rodgers and Hammerstein. He wrote with Jerome Kern, Vincent Youmans, Rudolf Friml and others, and changed the shape of the American musical. Learn about his life, family and mentorship of Stephen Sondheim and listen to his most beloved classics, including: “All The Things You Are,” “The Last Time I Saw Paris” and “Ol’ Man River.” With Oscar Andrew Hammerstein, biographer and grand-son of Oscar Hammerstein.
ShortDesc: Oscar Hammerstein had a wildly successful career before Rodgers and Hammerstein.
Title: Hammerstein Before Rodgers

MobileDesc:
Author and National Hall of Fame speaker, Scott Halford distills complex information about how the brain functions into easy-to-understand strategies and tools people can activate to transform how they live and work. Scott will combine research and anecdotal information with humor and inspiration to help you build a bridge between the complexities of neuroscience and the boots-on-the-ground demands of 21st century living.

Scott Halford will be signing copies of Activate Your Brain: How Understanding Your Brain can Improve Your Work – and Your Life following the event.
ShortDesc: Author and National Hall of Fame speaker, Scott Halford distills complex information about how the brain functions into easy-to-understand strategies and tools people can activate to transform how they live and work.
Title: Activate Your Brain and Improve Your Work

MobileDesc:
A decade after it hit land in New Orleans, Katrina remains the costliest natural disaster and one of the five deadliest hurricanes in US history. Join journalist Gary Rivlin as he retraces the storm’s immediate damage, the city of New Orleans’s efforts to rebuild itself and the storm’s lasting impact not just on the city’s geography and infrastructure—but on the psychic, racial and social fabric of one of this nation’s great cities.

Gary Rivlin will be signing copies of Katrina: After the Flood following the event.
ShortDesc: A decade after it hit land in New Orleans, Katrina remains the costliest natural disaster and one of the five deadliest hurricanes in US history.
Title: Katrina: After the Flood

MobileDesc:
Eighty-year-old Cornelius Gurlitt became a global media sensation in 2013 upon the discovery of over 1,400 art-works valued at $1.35 billion in his Munich apartment. Gurlitt had been hardwired into a life of secrecy, having inherited his father art collection built on the spoils of Jews during Hitler’s Third Reich. Author Susan Ronald chronicles the fascinating account of Gurlitt’s father, as detailed in her highly anticipated new book, Hitler’s Art Thief.

Susan Ronald will sign copies of her new book, Hitler’s Art Thief, following the event.
ShortDesc: Eighty-year-old Cornelius Gurlitt became a global media sensation in 2013 upon the discovery of over 1,400 art-works valued at $1.35 billion in his Munich apartment.
Title: Hitler's Art Thief

MobileDesc: Comic book art historian Arlen Schumer surveys the Jewish influence on the creation and development of the superhero, the significant contributions Jews have made to the creation of the comic book itself, and the evolution of comic book art in the 20th and 21st centuries.
ShortDesc: Comic book art historian Arlen Schumer surveys the Jewish influence on the creation and development of the superhero, the significant contributions Jews have made to the creation of the comic book itself, and the evolution of comic book art in the 20th and 21st centuries.
Title: Jews in Comics

MobileDesc: Betty Comden and Adolf Green have written the lyrics to some of Broadway’s biggest hits: On The Town, Wonderful Town, Bells Are Ringing, Peter Pan and Singin’ In The Rain and now on Broadway, On the 20th Century, to name a few. Take in these standards while hearing the anything-but-standard inside stories that shaped them.
ShortDesc: Betty Comden and Adolf Green have written the lyrics to some of Broadway’s biggest hits: On The Town, Wonderful Town, Bells Are Ringing, Peter Pan and Singin’ In The Rain and now on Broadway, On the 20th Century, to name a few.
Title: On Comden and Green

MobileDesc:
The Emmy Award-winning producers take you behind the scenes into some previously undisclosed stories of Hollywood productions and personalities like Fred Astaire, Katharine Hepburn, James Stewart, Johnny Carson, Frank Sinatra, Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, Jane Fonda, Richard Dreyfuss, Audrey Hepburn and Bette Davis.

David Heeley and Joan Kramer will be signing copies of In the Company of Legends following the event.
ShortDesc: The Emmy Award-winning producers take you behind the scenes into some previously undisclosed stories of Hollywood productions and personalities.
Title: In the Company of Legends

MobileDesc:
Will the future be one of economic expansion, greater tolerance, liberating inventions and longer, happier lives? Or do we face economic stagnation, declining quality of life and a technologically enhanced totalitarianism worse than any yet seen? Join professors and editors Morton Schapiro and Gary Saul Morson as they provide insight on what’s to come.

Gary Saul Morson and Morton Schapiro will be signing copies of The Fabulous Future?: America and World in 2040 following the event.
ShortDesc: Will the future be one of economic expansion, greater tolerance, liberating inventions and longer, happier lives?
Title: The Fabulous Future?: America and the World in 2040

MobileDesc:
Commemorating the 150th anniversary of one of the most beloved classics of children’s literature, Mark Burstein, president emeritus of the Lewis Carroll Society of North America, addresses the question, “What is it about Alice?” in the context of the first trade edition of Wonderland with illustrations by Salvador Dalí.

Mark Burstein will be signing copies of Alice in Wonderland (Lewis Carroll, illustrations by Salvador Dalí) and The Annotated Alice: 150th Anniversary Deluxe Edition following the event.
ShortDesc: Commemorating the 150th anniversary of one of the most beloved classics of children’s literature, Mark Burstein, addresses the question, “What is it about Alice?” in the context of the first trade edition of Wonderland with illustrations by Salvador Dalí.
Title: Alice and Wonderland at 150

MobileDesc:
Tracing the offstage/onstage workings of this famed New York institution, Charles Affron and Mirella Jona Affron tell how the Met became and remains a powerful actor on the global cultural scene. In their new history of the company, the first in thirty years, each of the chronologically sequenced chapters surveys a composer or a slice of the repertoire and brings to life dominant personalities and memorable performances of the time. Spanning the decades between the Gilded Age and the age of new media, this story of the Met concludes by tipping its hat to the hugely successful “Live in HD” simulcasts and raising the issues that confront the company today.

Charles Affron, Professor Emeritus of French Literature at New York University, and Mirella Jona Affron, Professor Emerita of Cinema Studies at The College of Staten Island/CUNY, are coauthors of Best Years: Going to the Movies, 1945–1946 and Sets in Motion: Art Direction and Film Narrative. Charles Affron is the author of Lillian Gish: Her Legend, Her Life; Cinema and Sentiment; and Star Acting: Gish, Garbo, Davis. Together with Robert Lyons, the authors are series editors of Rutgers Films in Print and Rutgers Depth of Field.
ShortDesc: Tracing the offstage/onstage workings of this famed New York institution, Charles Affron and Mirella Jona Affron tell how the Met became and remains a powerful actor on the global cultural scene.
Title: Grand Opera: The Story of the Met from Gilded Age to New Media

MobileDesc:
At its peak, J. Edgar Hoover’s notorious “Sex Deviates” file encompassed nearly more than 330,000 pages of information. In 1977-1978, these files were destroyed, and four decades of the FBI’s dirty secrets went up in smoke. Join noted history professor and author Douglas M. Charles as he fills in blanks of the bureau’s invasive, systematic interest in the lives of gay and lesbian Americans through a remarkable feat of investigative research, synthesis and scholarly detective work.

Douglas M. Charles is Associate Professor of History at The Pennsylvania State University, Greater Allegheny campus outside of Pittsburgh
ShortDesc: Douglas M. Charles received his Ph.D. in history at the University of Edinburgh and is Associate Professor of History at The Pennsylvania State University, Greater Allegheny. Follow Douglas for "on this day in history" moments from his book.
Title: Hoover’s War on Gays: Exposing the FBI’s “Sex Deviates” Program

MobileDesc: Did you know that women lead half of the Ivy League, many elite liberal arts colleges and giant public systems? Award-winning journalist Lisa Birnbach sits down with Nancy Cantor (chancellor of Rutgers–Newark), and presidents Amy Gutmann (U Penn), Biddy Martin (Amherst) and Christina Paxson (Brown) to discuss their career paths, balancing their distinguished careers with family, and the challenges they face in this era of overwhelming college costs and competition from online programs.
ShortDesc: Did you know that women lead half of the Ivy League, many elite liberal arts colleges and giant public systems?
Title: THE BENENSON LECTURE—Our Turn: Women Leading Academia

MobileDesc: Rodgers and Hammerstein enriched our lives with Oklahoma, Carousel, South Pacific, The King and I and The Sound of Music. But few know the stories behind the shows, and the challenges they encountered throughout their storied careers. Join us for an inside account of the most successful team in Broadway history, while enjoying hits like: “Oh What a Beautiful Morning,” “Some Enchanted Evening” and “The Sound of Music.”
ShortDesc: Rodgers and Hammerstein enriched our lives with Oklahoma, Carousel, South Pacific, The King and I and The Sound of Music.
Title: On Rodgers and Hammerstein

MobileDesc: George Gershwin spent many a fashionable 1920’s Manhattan party at the piano, spinning out endless improvisations on the songs he had written with his brother, Ira. The saying was that, “An evening with Gershwin was a Gershwin evening.” Fortunately for all of us, he recorded some of these remarkable versions, and for those who haven’t heard them, they are a revelation, offering a direct, intimate portrait of how he heard his music. This lecture will explore this piano-centered side of Gershwin via these vintage recordings and performances and interviews taken from live radio broadcasts. As Ira, wrote, “’S Wonderful.”
ShortDesc: George Gershwin spent many a fashionable 1920’s Manhattan party at the piano, spinning out endless improvisations on the songs he had written with his brother, Ira.
Title: Behind the Music with Louis Rosen: Gershwin at the Piano

MobileDesc: To celebrate her ninetieth birthday, Tony Vellela highlights life and remarkable career of Dame Angela Lansbury, winner of five Tony Awards, six Golden Globes, an Olivier and an Honorary Oscar. Focusing on her Broadway endeavors, Mr. Vellela will share exclusive video interviews he conducted with Ms. Lansbury, discussing her legendary performances in Stephen Sondheim and Hugh Wheeler's Sweeney Todd, or the Demon Barber of Fleet Street, Jerry Herman's smash hit Mame and her iconic portrayal of Madame Rose in Gypsy. According to creators Arthur Laurents and Sondheim, it was her performance that resurrected their musical from being considered only a vehicle for Ethel Merman.
ShortDesc: To celebrate her ninetieth birthday, Tony Vellela highlights life and remarkable career of Dame Angela Lansbury, winner of five Tony Awards, six Golden Globes, an Olivier and an Honorary Oscar.
Title: On Angela Lansbury’s Broadway Career

MobileDesc:
Humans are inherently social creatures. But from roommate disputes to family arguments, trouble is inevitable in most any interpersonal relationships. Author Robert M. Emerson explores the beginnings and development of the conflicts that occur in our relationships with the people we regularly encounter—family members, intimate partners, coworkers and others—and the common responses to such troubles. Hermits aside, this is one talk you don’t want to miss!

Robert M. Emerson will be signing copies of Everyday Troubles: The MicroPolitics of Interpersonal Conflict following the event.
ShortDesc: Humans are inherently social creatures. But from roommate disputes to family arguments, trouble is inevitable in most any interpersonal relationships.
Title: Everyday Troubles: The Micropolitics of Interpersonal Conflict

MobileDesc:
Plenty has been written about artists’ inspirations, but how do artists actually go about their work? What do their studios look like? What are their work habits? Brooklyn artist Joe Fig offers one of the most sustained and intensive engagements with the creative process of studio artists. Join him as he discusses with some of today’s most exciting contemporary artists the innermost details of their working routines, how they set up their studio and how they set a creative mood in what’s sure to be a riveting discussion.

Joe Fig and the artists will be signing copies of Inside the Artist’s Studio following the event.
ShortDesc: Plenty has been written about artists’ inspirations, but how do artists actually go about their work? What do their studios look like? What are their work habits?
Title: Inside the Artist’s Studio

MobileDesc:
Discover the raw and revealing story of the self-proclaimed Harlem Rattlers, the African-American WWI combat unit who were said to have never lost a man to capture or a foot of ground that had been taken. Author Jeffrey T. Sammons details their mythic status and legendary heroics, and discusses the centrality of military service and war to the quest for equality and postwar struggles of the 369th.

Jeffrey T. Sammons will be signing copies of Harlem’s Rattlers and the Great War following the event.
ShortDesc: Discover the raw and revealing story of the self-proclaimed Harlem Rattlers, the African-American WWI combat unit who were said to have never lost a man to capture or a foot of ground that had been taken.
Title: Harlem’s Rattlers and the Great War

MobileDesc: From annoying to debilitating, headaches can be a real pain! Dr. Louise Klebanoff, Neurologist and Chief of General Neurology at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center explains how to avoid them, how to treat them and when to worry. Understand what migraine, tension and cluster headaches are, and how to help your doctor make the right diagnosis. Learn about treatment options from lifestyle changes and natural supplements to prescription medication and even surgery. Know what symptoms should prompt urgent evaluation.
ShortDesc: From annoying to debilitating, headaches can be a real pain! Dr. Louise Klebanoff, Neurologist and Chief of General Neurology at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Medical Center explains how to avoid them, how to treat them and when to worry.
Title: Headaches 101

MobileDesc:
Join two pioneers in the field to hear the latest thinking about risk factors, prevention, detection and treatment of breast cancer.

Dr. Susan Love will be signing copies of the Dr. Susan Love’s Breast Book, Sixth Edition following the event.
ShortDesc: Join two pioneers in the field to hear the latest thinking about risk factors, prevention, detection and treatment of breast cancer.
Title: The Latest on Breast Cancer with Drs. Larry Norton and Susan Love

MobileDesc: It’s no secret that American cities are enjoying a 21st century renaissance. Today, 80% of us and counting live in an urban area, and Americans—especially younger Americans—are increasingly looking to make their homes in our big cities. Given these trends, Stephanie K. Meeks, President and CEO of the National Trust for Historic Preservation, will present compelling new research on the social and economic impact of older buildings, and talk about the critical role historic buildings play—in New York and across the country—in creating jobs, strengthening neighborhoods, spurring revitalization, expanding prosperity and improving quality of life.
ShortDesc: It’s no secret that American cities are enjoying a 21st century renaissance.
Title: Older Buildings, Livable Cities: Historic Preservation and the Dynamic Urban Environment

MobileDesc:
An internationally renowned autism expert offers a new paradigm: the most successful approaches to autism don’t aim at fixing a person by eliminating symptoms, but rather seeking to understand the individual’s experience and what underlies the behavior.

Dr. Barry M. Prizant will be signing copies of Uniquely Human: A Different Way of Seeing Autism following the event.
ShortDesc: An internationally renowned autism expert offers a new paradigm: the most successful approaches to autism don’t aim at fixing a person by eliminating symptoms, but rather seeking to understand the individual’s experience and what underlies the behavior.
Title: Autism: A Uniquely Human Experience

MobileDesc: Health care in the U.S. faces an imperative for change. Americans are living longer and getting sicker. Market forces and the Affordable Care Act mean that health care providers are being reimbursed substantially less while caring for more patients. And, most importantly, people will be paying more out of pocket for their care. Learn about how transformative 21st Century innovations are changing treatment options and how to navigate the system to get higher-quality, lower-cost care for you and your family.
ShortDesc: Health care in the U.S. faces an imperative for change. Americans are living longer and getting sicker.
Title: Navigating the US Health Care System

MobileDesc:
Join fashion authority Hal Rubenstein as he showcases the seminal moments in film and television, and on the runway and red carpet, that have forever changed the way we look at love.

Hal Rubenstein will be signing The Looks of Love: 50 Moments in Fashion That Inspired Romance following the event.
ShortDesc: Join fashion authority Hal Rubenstein as he showcases the seminal moments in film and television, and on the runway and red carpet, that have forever changed the way we look at love.
Title: The Looks of Love: 50 Moments in Fashion That Inspired Romance

MobileDesc:
Despite being perceived as a plain Jane who was married for her money, it turns out Lady Bird Johnson is arguably one of the most influential First Ladies in presidential history. Betty Boyd Caroli, author of Lady Bird and Lyndon: The Hidden Story of a Marriage That Made a President, provides an inside look at Lady Bird’s behind-the-scenes role as a key strategist, fundraiser, barnstormer, peacemaker and indispensable therapist to the president.

Betty Boyd Caroli will be signing copies of Lady Bird and Lyndon following the event.
ShortDesc: Despite being perceived as a plain Jane who was married for her money, it turns out Lady Bird Johnson is arguably one of the most influential First Ladies in presidential history.
Title: Psychobiography with Dr. Gail Saltz: On Lady Bird and Lyndon Johnson with Betty Boyd Caroli

MobileDesc:
How do you combine the cognitive science behind memory, sleep and stress to care for your brain? Former Surgeon General Dr. Richard Carmona guides you through the best of traditional and alternative therapies, behavioral science and exercise physiology to help you maintain a strong, agile mind so that your body does not outlive your brain. He will discuss the anatomy of the aging brain, how stress and toxins affect your mind and the importance of sleep.

Dr. Richard Carmona will be signing copies of Canyon Ranch: 30 Days to a Better Brain following the event.
ShortDesc: How do you combine the cognitive science behind memory, sleep and stress to care for your brain?
Title: Improve your Memory, Concentration, Mood and Well-Being

MobileDesc: From humble beginnings, the NYC marathon has grown into the biggest and most widely viewed event in the running world. Join a panel of professionals and enthusiasts for stories around the growth of the event and the incredible experiences of some of these athletes along the way.
ShortDesc: From humble beginnings, the NYC marathon has grown into the biggest and most widely viewed event in the running world.
Title: The New York City Marathon: Amazing Stories from the World’s Biggest Race

MobileDesc:
More than half a century after Eisenhower left office, the history of his presidency is so clouded by myth, partisanship and outright fraud that most people have little understanding of how Ike’s administration worked or what it accomplished. Join author Irwin F. Gellman as he reveals a different side of Eisenhower than that of popular belief, exploring everything from his distrust of his VP, Richard Nixon, to his initial planning of the Bay of Pigs.

Irwin F. Gellman will sign copies of his new book, The President and the Apprentice: Eisenhower and Nixon, 1952-1961, following the event.
ShortDesc: More than half a century after Eisenhower left office, the history of his presidency is so clouded by myth, partisanship and outright fraud that most people have little understanding of how Ike’s administration worked or what it accomplished.
Title: The President and the Apprentice: Eisenhower and Nixon, 1952-1961

MobileDesc:
The design dream team of landscape architect Edmund Hollander and architect Thomas A. Kligerman pull aside the curtain on what it really takes to create a beautifully integrated home—from the inside out, and the outside in. Learn how this duo works to merge aesthetics and create a unified vision as they talk with interior designer Ellie Cullman.

Edmund Hollander will be signing copies of The Good Garden: The Landscape Architecture of Edmund Hollander Design following the event.
ShortDesc: The design dream team of landscape architect Edmund Hollander and architect Thomas A. Kligerman pull aside the curtain on what it really takes to create a beautifully integrated home—from the inside out, and the outside in.
Title: Landscape/Architecture: A Design Dream Team

MobileDesc:
Organic farming is no longer a niche movement for humus-loving hippies. It’s a multi-billion-dollar industry, spanning from family farms to agricultural conglomerates, from supermarkets to farmers markets. Join author and lecturer Robin O’Sullivan as she charts organic’s history and future trajectory upon the launch of her new book, chronicling the rise of organic farming and culture and its increasingly prominence in American life and culture.

Robin O’Sullivan will be signing copies of American Organic: A Cultural History of Farming, Gardening, Shopping, and Eating following the event.
ShortDesc: Organic farming is no longer a niche movement for humus-loving hippies.
Title: American Organic: A Cultural History of Farming, Gardening, Shopping and Eating

MobileDesc:
Raised by an abusive grandmother in his family’s brothels, Richard Pryor may have been the most unlikely star in Hollywood history. He took the stage originally to escape his harsh childhood reality, but later discovered he could alchemize his stand-up by delving fully, even painfully, into the “off-color” life he’d known. Biographer Scott Saul sheds light on an entertainer who, by uniting the spirits of the Black Power movement and the counterculture, forever altered comedy.

Scott Saul will be signing copies of Becoming Richard Pryor following the event.
ShortDesc: Raised by an abusive grandmother in his family’s brothels, Richard Pryor may have been the most unlikely star in Hollywood history.
Title: Becoming Richard Pryor

MobileDesc:
This November, the Jewish Museum will present Unorthodox, a large-scale group exhibition featuring over 50 contemporary artists from around the world whose practices mix forms and genres without concern for artistic conventions. Though the artists in Unorthodox come from a wide variety of backgrounds and generations, they are united in their spirit of independence and individuality. Their iconoclastic works examine social and political values, religion and humanism, trauma and identity, and explore the relationship between the human figure and the modern creative process. Exhibition curators Daniel S. Palmer and Kelly Taxter explain their process and introduce the artists and their work here at 92Y, then we will walk over to the Jewish Museum where Jens Hoffmann, Deputy Director, Exhibitions and Public Programs, leads a tour of the exhibition at the Jewish Museum.

Unorthodox is organized by Jens Hoffmann, Deputy Director, Exhibitions and Public Programs, Daniel S. Palmer, Leon Levy Assistant Curator, and Kelly Taxter, Assistant Curator and will be on view at the Jewish Museum from November 6, 2015 to March 27, 2016.

This event is part of a series of programs that will take place both at the Jewish Museum and at 92nd Street Y in conjunction with the exhibition Unorthodox. The accompanying public programs—which also include “Unorthodox Exhibitions” (November 2015 ), “Unorthodox Artists” (November 2015) and “Unorthodox Museums” (March 2016)—investigate the same notion of defying cultural and artistic uniformity.
ShortDesc: This November, the Jewish Museum will present Unorthodox, a large-scale group exhibition featuring over 50 contemporary artists from around the world whose practices mix forms and genres without concern for artistic conventions.
Title: Inside the Jewish Museum’s Unorthodox: A Talk and Tour

MobileDesc: Dr. Michael Sein, a physiatrist at New York-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, explains the causes of herniated discs, sprains and muscle spasms and discusses treatments.
ShortDesc: Dr. Michael Sein, a physiatrist at New York-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, explains the causes of herniated discs, sprains and muscle spasms and discusses treatments.
Title: Pain-Free: A Healthy Neck and Back

MobileDesc:
Legendary dance photographer Lois Greenfield captures the grace and athleticism of some of the most talented dancers of our generation. Her gravity-defying images express the possibilities of contemporary dance reflected through her inimitable lens. Join Greenfield and some of her iconic subjects—dancers whose work has, in turn, been influenced  by working with her, and who are featured in her newest book, Moving Still.

Lois Greenfield and the dancers will be signing copies of Greenfield’s Moving Still following the event.
ShortDesc: Legendary dance photographer Lois Greenfield captures the grace and athleticism of some of the most talented dancers of our generation.
Title: Photographing Dancers in Motion

MobileDesc:
Central Park has often been called one of America's greatest works of art. The park itself has attracted many major American painters—and some unexpected Europeans—from the time it was created in 1860 through the present. The American artists range from Winslow Homer and Impressionists like William Merritt Chase, Childe Hassam and Maurice Prendergast to most members of the Ashcan School and The Eight to mid-20th Century painters from Milton Avery and Fairfield Porter to Helen Frankenthaler and on to contemporary artists including Christo and Richard Estes. Europeans include George Grosz, Marc Chagall and David Hockney.

In his talk, Roger Pasquier will lead a virtual walking tour through the park, using paintings by the artists to show how its key features were depicted. On the way, he will discuss how the park transformed social and recreational life for New Yorkers and how Central Park's landscape and buildings attracted artists who recognized that it offered subjects not available anyplace else in America. He will also show some of the parallels between paintings and writings about the park in the fiction of Henry James, Edith Wharton, J.D. Salinger and others.

Roger Pasquier will be signing copies of Painting Central Park following the event.
ShortDesc: Central Park has often been called one of America's greatest works of art.
Title: Painting Central Park

MobileDesc:
Three years ago, Rita Gabis discovered an unthinkable dimension to her family story: from 1941 to 1943, her grandfather had been chief of security police under the Gestapo in the Lithuanian town of Sˇvencˇionys, near the killing field of Poligon, where eight thousand Jews were murdered over three days in 1941. In 1942, the local Polish population was also hunted down. Learn the compelling, complicated truth about Gabis’ grandfather and what he had done.

Rita Gabis will sign copies of her new book, A Guest at the Shooters' Banquet: My Grandfather's SS Past, My Jewish Family, A Search for the Truth, following the event.
ShortDesc: Three years ago, Rita Gabis discovered an unthinkable dimension to her family story: from 1941 to 1943, her grandfather had been chief of security police under the Gestapo in the Lithuanian town of Sˇvencˇionys, where eight thousand Jews were murdered over three days in 1941.
Title: A Guest at the Shooters’ Banquet

MobileDesc: Leading dermatologist Dr. Ellen Marmur shares her expertise in what works and what doesn’t when it comes to skin health and your everyday skin care routine.
ShortDesc: Leading dermatologist Dr. Ellen Marmur shares her expertise in what works and what doesn’t when it comes to skin health and your everyday skin care routine.
Title: Skincare 101

MobileDesc: Cole Porter’s “Night And Day”, Jerome Kern’s “The Way You Look Tonight” and Irving Berlin’s “Cheek to Cheek.” The music to which Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers danced is some of the most beautiful and stirring in the American Songbook. Come hear the songs and the stories behind them that made Fred and Ginger trip the light fantastic.
ShortDesc: Cole Porter’s “Night And Day”, Jerome Kern’s “The Way You Look Tonight” and Irving Berlin’s “Cheek to Cheek.”
Title: On the Music of Fred and Ginger

MobileDesc:
Bob Hope achieved top-rated success in every mass-entertainment medium, from vaudeville to television and everything in between. He helped redefine the very notion of what it means to be a star: a savvy businessman and public-spirited entertainer whose tireless work for charity set the standard for public service in Hollywood. Join biographer Richard Zoglin for a complex portrait of a gifted and yet flawed entertainer and star.

Richard Zoglin will sign copies of his book Hope: Entertainer of the Century following the event.
ShortDesc: Bob Hope achieved top-rated success in every mass-entertainment medium, from vaudeville to television and everything in between.
Title: On Bob Hope

MobileDesc: Sammy Cahn wrote some of the most popular songs of the Great American Songbook, including more songs for Frank Sinatra than any other songwriter. Join entertainer and music historian, Harvey Granat for wonderful inside stories about Cahn’s life, songs and star singers, including, of course, Sinatra. Among the songs you’ll hear are: “Come Fly with Me,” “All the Way” and “Call Me Irresponsible.”
ShortDesc: Sammy Cahn wrote some of the most popular songs of the Great American Songbook, including more songs for Frank Sinatra than any other songwriter.
Title: On Sammy Cahn

MobileDesc: Learn 10 new ways to find calm during a hectic day that don't involve any calories whatsoever. Clinical psychologist, Dr. Susan Albers, a clinical psychologist, discusses ancient and modern strategies for coping with stress.
ShortDesc: Learn 10 new ways to find calm during a hectic day that don't involve any calories whatsoever.
Title: 10 Proven, Easy Ways to Calm & Soothe Yourself without Food

MobileDesc:
The terrorist attacks of 9/11 are indelibly etched into our memory. But they also created complex legal ramifications and heated debate that continues unabated on the limits of government power in the name of national security. Join military and constitutional law expert Allan A. Ryan as he discusses the nuanced complexities of cases such as Rasul v. Bush and Hamdi v. Rumsfeld, Hamdan v. Bush, and Boumediene v. Bush, and their profound implications for our society.

Allan A. Ryan will be signing copies of The 9/11 Terror Cases: Constitutional Challenges in the War against Al Qaeda following the event.
ShortDesc: The terrorist attacks of 9/11 are indelibly etched into our memory. But they also created complex legal ramifications and heated debate that continues unabated on the limits of government power in the name of national security.
Title: The 9/11 Terror Cases and their Constitutional Challenges

MobileDesc:
Johannes Brahms is one of history’s most influential composers. But there’s a little-known side to Brahms: the boy who played piano in beer halls among prostitutes and drunken sailors, the fiercely self-protective man who thwarted future biographers by burning papers, scores and notebooks late in his life. Renowned music composer and author Jan Swafford offers richly expanded perspectives.

Jan Swafford will be signing copies of Johannes Brahms: A Biography following the event.
ShortDesc: Johannes Brahms is one of history’s most influential composers.
Title: Psychobiography with Dr. Gail Saltz: On Johannes Brahms with Jan Swafford

MobileDesc:
Explore literary and culinary roads to happiness with Cara Nicoletti, a third-generation butcher/baker/blogger whose passion for books and food led her to write Voracious: A Hungry Reader Cooks Her Way through Great Books. She talks with Jenny Rosenstrach, bestselling author of Dinner: A Love Story, as they both share a literary feast of stories and recipes inspired by beloved books and the meals that give their characters depth and personality.

Cara Nicoletti will sign copies of her new book, Voracious: A Hungry Reader Cooks Her Way through Great Books, following the event.
ShortDesc: Explore literary and culinary roads to happiness with Cara Nicoletti, a third-generation butcher/baker/blogger whose passion for books and food led her to write Voracious: A Hungry Reader Cooks Her Way through Great Books.
Title: Voracious! A Literary Feast with Cara Nicoletti and Jenny Rosenstrach

MobileDesc:
Just in time for the High Holidays, Kim Kushner, author of The New Kosher, and chefs, cookbook authors and brothers Max and Eli Sussman talk with Adam Sachs, editor in chief of Saveur, about the evolution of Jewish cuisine and what Jewish cooking is today.

Kim Kushner will be signing copies of The New Kosher and Max & Eli Sussman will be signing copies of Classic Recipes for Modern People following the event.
ShortDesc: Just in time for the High Holidays, Kim Kushner, author of The New Kosher, and chefs, cookbook authors and brothers Max and Eli Sussman talk with Adam Sachs, editor in chief of Saveur, about the evolution of Jewish cuisine and what Jewish cooking is today.
Title: Reimagining Jewish Cooking with Kim Kushner, Max and Eli Sussman, and Adam Sachs

MobileDesc:
Maangchi has been called the Julia Child of Korean cooking—an amazing source for authentic Korean recipes that she whips up for her millions of fans on YouTube and her website. She has won the admiration of home cooks and chefs alike with her trademark combination of good technique and good cheer as she demonstrates the vast and delicious cuisine of Korea. Join her for a discussion about Korea’s best familiar and unfamiliar cuisine—from Bulgogi and Kimchi to Korean Fried Chicken to Bibimbap—as she talks with Hooni Kim, chef at Danji and Hanjan.

Maangchi will sign copies of her book, Maangchi’s Real Korean Cooking, after the event.
ShortDesc: Maangchi has been called the Julia Child of Korean cooking—an amazing source for authentic Korean recipes that she whips up for her millions of fans on YouTube and her website.
Title: Maangchi‘s Real Korean Cooking

MobileDesc:
Yale history professor Timothy Snyder discusses his new book, Black Earth: The Holocaust as History and Warning. He gives a new explanation of the great atrocity of the 20th century, and reveals the risks that we face in the 21st. By overlooking the lessons of the Holocaust, we have misunderstood modernity and endangered the future. Join us for what’s sure to be a groundbreaking and absorbing discussion.

Timothy Snyder will be signing copies of Black Earth: The Holocaust as History and Warning following the event.
ShortDesc: Yale history professor Timothy Snyder discusses his new book, Black Earth: The Holocaust as History and Warning.
Title: Black Earth: The Holocaust as History and Warning

MobileDesc:
Join the host of “The Reid Report” on MSNBC, the Grio.com managing editor and Miami Herald columnist Joy-Ann Reid as she charts the complicated relationship between Barack Obama and Bill and Hillary Clinton, showing how the Democratic party’s faithful and its power players have been caught in a whirl of shifting allegiances to each—and how this ever-changing strategic balance is shaping the party and its hopes to retain the White House.

Joy-Ann Reid will be signing copies of Fracture: Barack Obama, the Clintons and the Racial Divide following the event.
ShortDesc: Join the host of “The Reid Report” on MSNBC, the Grio.com managing editor and Miami Herald columnist Joy-Ann Reid as she charts the complicated relationship between Barack Obama and Bill and Hillary Clinton.
Title: Barack Obama, the Clintons and the Racial Divide

MobileDesc: Join MoMA curators Ann Temkin and Anne Umland as they bring you inside their new exhibition, Picasso Sculpture, on view at MoMA from September 14, 2015–February 7, 2016.
ShortDesc: Join MoMA curators Ann Temkin and Anne Umland as they bring you inside their new exhibition, Picasso Sculpture, on view at MoMA from September 14, 2015–February 7, 2016.
Title: MoMA’s Picasso Sculptures

MobileDesc:
Author, lawyer and pundit Linda Hirshman tells the fascinating story of Sandra Day O'Connor and Ruth Bader Ginsburg, the first and second women to serve as Supreme Court justices.< Republican and Democrat, Christian and Jew, western rancher’s daughter and Brooklyn girl—the two have a relationship that transcends party, religion, region and culture. Strengthened by each other’s presence, these groundbreaking judges have transformed the Constitution and America itself, making it a more equal place for all women.

Linda Hirshman will be signing copies of Sisters in Law: Sandra Day O’Connor and Ruth Bader Ginsburg following the event.
ShortDesc: Author, lawyer and pundit Linda Hirshman tells the fascinating story of Sandra Day O'Connor and Ruth Bader Ginsburg, the first and second women to serve as Supreme Court justices.
Title: Sisters in Law: The Story of Sandra Day O’Connor and Ruth Bader Ginsburg

MobileDesc:
Digital pirates overseas steal and resell hundreds of billions of dollars in American intellectual property each year. On a website called CRACK99, Xiang Li sold everything from satellite tracking and aviation simulation to communications systems design software for mere pennies on the dollar. When federal prosecutor and former U.S. Navy intelligence officer David Locke Hall and his team started buying CRACK99’s products, the hunt for this elusive pirate began. David Locke Hall brings us inside the dark side of cybercrime, the most successful software piracy sting and the chilling consequences for national security today.

David Locke Hall will be signing copies of The Takedown of a $100 Million Chinese Software Pirate following the event.
ShortDesc: Digital pirates overseas steal and resell hundreds of billions of dollars in American intellectual property each year.
Title: The Takedown of a $100 Million Chinese Software Pirate

MobileDesc: We are living longer and healthier than all previous generations, but every 70 seconds someone is diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease. Dr. Mayeux, chairman of the department of neurology, New York-Presbyterian/Columbia University Medical Center answers the ten most frequently asked questions regarding diagnosis, treatment, risk, prevention and research.
ShortDesc: We are living longer and healthier than all previous generations, but every 70 seconds someone is diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease.
Title: Alzheimer’s Disease: Running in the Family

MobileDesc: Join Milton Esterow, former editor and publisher of ARTnews, to understand how Impressionism became the most popular art style in the world and grew to become the wealthy collectors’ ultimate status symbol. Learn about the artists, dealers, early supporters (who nearly went bankrupt), collectors, critics and everyone else that helped make Impressionism so famous around the world.
ShortDesc: Join Milton Esterow, former editor and publisher of ARTnews, to understand how Impressionism became the most popular art style in the world and grew to become the wealthy collectors’ ultimate status symbol.
Title: Inventing Impressionism

MobileDesc: From painting to sculpture, from theoretical treatises to architecture, Michelangelo challenged the conventions of his time and left the world with signature masterpieces. Go inside the mind and musings of the the archetypal Renaissance Man.
ShortDesc: From painting to sculpture, from theoretical treatises to architecture, Michelangelo challenged the conventions of his time and left the world with signature masterpieces.
Title: A Renaissance Genius: Michelangelo in Rome

MobileDesc:
For most of us, clicking “like” on social media has become fairly routine. For a Marine, clicking “like” from the battlefield lets his entire social network—including loved ones—know he’s alive. This is the first time in the history of modern warfare that US troops have direct, instantaneous connection to civilian life back home. Professor Lisa Ellen Silvestri reveals how social media is changing what it’s like to be at war, exploring its impact good, bad and ugly.

Lisa Ellen Silvestri will be signing copies of Friended at the Front: Social Media in the American War Zone following the event.
ShortDesc: For most of us, clicking “like” on social media has become fairly routine.
Title: Social Media in the American War Zone

MobileDesc:
Join the people we all should thank for helping make the beer we buy actually taste of something. Brooklyn Brewery’s Steve Hindy (author of Beer School) and Garrett Oliver (author of The Brewmaster’s Table) share the improbable story of how their revolutionary company grew from a home-brew hobby into a multimillion-dollar business—in the most competitive beer market in the US. Tasting included.

There will be a beer tasting, and Stephen Hindy and Garrett Oliver will be signing copies of The Craft Beer Revolution following the event.
ShortDesc: Join the people we all should thank for helping make the beer we buy actually taste of something.
Title: Brooklyn Brewery and the Craft Beer Revolution

MobileDesc:
A California native, Claire Ptak worked as a pastry chef for Alice Waters at Chez Paniesse before moving to London and opening Violet, a bijou cake shop and café. Jamie Oliver has called her his “favourite cake maker in the whole world.” She talks with Elisabeth Prueitt of Tartine Bakery and Bar Tartine.

Claire Ptak will be signing copies of The Violet Bakery Cookbook following the event.
ShortDesc: A California native, Claire Ptak worked as a pastry chef for Alice Waters at Chez Paniesse before moving to London and opening Violet, a bijou cake shop and café.
Title: Talking about Cakes: Claire Ptak of London’s Violet Bakery and Elisabeth Prueitt of Tartine with Christine Muhlke

MobileDesc:
Ever wondered how to pan-fry a steak with a charred crust and an interior that’s perfectly medium-rare from edge to edge? How to roast a succulent, moist turkey without brining—with a foolproof method that works every time? The answer is all in the science. Join Serious Eats’ culinary nerd-in-residence for a grand tour of the science of cooking explored through favorite American dishes.

J. Kenji Lopez-Alt will be signing copies of his new book, The Food Lab: Better Home Cooking Through Science, following the event.
ShortDesc: Ever wondered how to pan-fry a steak with a charred crust and an interior that’s perfectly medium-rare from edge to edge? How to roast a succulent, moist turkey without brining—with a foolproof method that works every time?
Title: J. Kenji Lopez-Alt with Ed Levine

MobileDesc:
Since opening Zahav in Philadelphia in 2008, chef Michael Solomonov has been turning heads with his original interpretations of modern Israeli cuisine. His food showcases the melting-pot cooking of Israel, especially the influences of the Middle East, North Africa, the Mediterranean and Eastern Europe, while using local and seasonal ingredients. Join chef Solomonov as he shares his personal story of how he embraced the food of his birthplace with Zahav.

Michael Solomonov will be signing copies of Zahav: A World of Israeli Cooking following the event.
ShortDesc: Since opening Zahav in Philadelphia in 2008, chef Michael Solomonov has been turning heads with his original interpretations of modern Israeli cuisine.
Title: Zahav: A World of Israeli Cooking

MobileDesc:
Join Enrique Olvera, pioneer of contemporary, authentic Mexican food and global gourmet influencer, to hear about his debut English language cookbook, Mexico from the Inside Out. Olvera’s restaurant Pujol was ranked first in Mexico and twentieth in the world at the World’s 50 Best Restaurant Awards. His restaurant Cosme, which opened in NYC last year, recently received a 3-star rave in The New York Times. Get an inside look at Enrique’s vision and philosophy about food.

Enrique Olvera will be signing copies of Mexico from the Inside Out following the event.
ShortDesc: Join Enrique Olvera, pioneer of contemporary, authentic Mexican food and global gourmet influencer, to hear about his debut English language cookbook, Mexico from the Inside Out.
Title: Enrique Olvera's Mexico

MobileDesc: But that’s SO much easier said than done. Join a panel of food experts to hear their strategies for overcoming challenges like feeding a picky eater, coping with food allergies, as well as building a positive body image and eating for a healthy planet.
ShortDesc: But that’s SO much easier said than done.
Title: Kids in the Kitchen: Raising Happy Eaters in a Time of Food Craziness

MobileDesc:
Daniel Humm and Will Guidara run two of New York’s most pioneering restaurants: Eleven Madison Park and the NoMad. Their team is known for perfectly executed cooking and creating extraordinary, genre-defying dining experiences. Bar director Leo Robitschek helped reinvent the cocktail program at Eleven Madison Park and the NoMad. Join them as they share food and drink recipes and stories from The NoMad Cookbook.

Daniel Humm, Will Guidara and Leo Robitschek will be signing copies of The NoMad Cookbook following the event.
ShortDesc: Daniel Humm and Will Guidara run two of New York’s most pioneering restaurants: Eleven Madison Park and the NoMad.
Title: Daniel Humm, Will Guidara and Leo Robitschek with Gail Simmons

MobileDesc:
The editor of Best Food Writing brings a selection of writers of this year’s tastiest prose. Hear a range of voices—James Beard Award winners, writer-chefs, bestselling authors and bloggers for a delicious evening of readings and stories.

Holly Hughes will be signing copies of Best Food Writing 2015 following the event.
ShortDesc: The editor of Best Food Writing brings a selection of writers of this year’s tastiest prose.
Title: Holly Hughes: Best Food Writing 2015

MobileDesc: Join international spirits expert Dave Broom, author of Gin: The Manual, for a heuristic exploration of the joys of gin. Understand the history of gin; find out what makes the perfect martini (why shaken may not be better than stirred); learn about juniper-heavy and delicate aromatic gins; discover which gin makes the best Negroni; and learn how to enjoy gin through a guided tasting.
ShortDesc: Join international spirits expert Dave Broom, author of Gin: The Manual, for a heuristic exploration of the joys of gin.
Title: The Joys of Gin

MobileDesc:
James Beard Outstanding Chef in the USA-winner Michael Anthony of Gramercy Tavern and Untitled, the restaurant at the new Whitney Museum, shares his secrets for creating delicious fresh flavors from his new book, V Is for Vegetables. If you shop at the CSA or farmer’s market, walk home with a basket of fresh-from-the-farm produce—then have no idea what to do with them when you get to the kitchen, this talk is a must-see!

Michael Anthony will be signing copies of V is for Vegetables following the event.
ShortDesc: James Beard Outstanding Chef in the USA-winner Michael Anthony of Gramercy Tavern and Untitled, the restaurant at the new Whitney Museum, shares his secrets for creating delicious fresh flavors from his new book, V Is for Vegetables.
Title: Michael Anthony Talks Vegetables! with John T. Edge

MobileDesc:
Five years ago, Eric Werner and Mya Henry left New York City to build their dream restaurant in the one-road town of Tulum, Mexico. They talk with Condé Nast Traveler editor-in-chief Pilar Guzmán about discovering the rich and inspiring heritage of the Yucatán. A book signing follow the event.

Eric Werner and Mya Henry will sign copies of their cookbook, Hartwood, following the event.
ShortDesc: Five years ago, Eric Werner and Mya Henry left New York City to build their dream restaurant in the one-road town of Tulum, Mexico.
Title: Hartwood: Bright Wild Flavors from the Edge of the Yucatán

MobileDesc:
Pastry chef François Payard shares some of his all-time favorite cookie recipes featured in Payard Cookies—the bestsellers at his popular New York City patisseries and cafés, the recipes he learned from his father, and the ones he makes at home.

François Payard will be signing copies of Payard Cookies following the event.
ShortDesc: Pastry chef François Payard shares some of his all-time favorite cookie recipes featured in Payard Cookies—the bestsellers at his popular New York City patisseries and cafés, the recipes he learned from his father, and the ones he makes at home.
Title: François Payard’s Cookies with Michael Laiskonis

MobileDesc:
Chef Dominique Crenn, the creative force behind San Francisco’s two Michelin-starred Atelier Crenn, brings her much anticipated first cookbook, Atelier Crenn: Metamorphosis of Taste, to 92Y. Hear her views on creativity, running a restaurant, being a top female chef in a world dominated by men, and more.

Dominique Crenn will be signing copies of Atelier Crenn: Metamorphosis of Taste following the event.
ShortDesc: Chef Dominique Crenn, the creative force behind San Francisco’s two Michelin-starred Atelier Crenn, brings her much anticipated first cookbook, Atelier Crenn: Metamorphosis of Taste, to 92Y.
Title: Dominique Crenn's Atelier

MobileDesc:
No one knows Indian food like Madhur Jaffrey. For more than forty years, the “godmother of Indian cooking” (The Independent on Sunday) has introduced Western home cooks to the vibrant cuisines of her homeland. Join the seven-time James Beard Award–winning author to hear about the delectable, healthful, vegetable- and grain-based foods enjoyed around the Indian subcontinent she presents in her new book, Vegetarian India: A Journey Through the Best of Indian Home Cooking.

Madhur Jaffrey will be signing copies of Vegetarian India following the event.
ShortDesc: No one knows Indian food like Madhur Jaffrey.
Title: Madhur Jaffrey: Vegetarian India with Karen Page

MobileDesc:
2015 marks the 50th anniversary since the groundbreaking Vatican II Council and Nostra Aetate forever transformed Catholic-Jewish relations. In the U.S. today, the majority of Latino individuals identify as Catholic. Come learn from a distinguished panel on the current state of Catholic-Jewish relations, particularly during the age of Pope Francis, the first Pope from Latin America.

Moderated by Rabbi David Sandmel, PhD: Director of Interfaith Affairs, Anti-Defamation League.

Distinguished Panelists

  • Rabbi Aaron Panken, PhD: President, Hebrew Union College.
  • Reverend Brian McWeeney, D.Min: Director of Interreligious and Ecumenical Affairs, Archdiocese of New York.
  • Judith Banki, D.H.L.: Current scholar at the Tanenbaum Center for Interreligious Understanding. Author of The Image of the Jews in Catholic Teaching, a memorandum which helped pave the way for the adoption of the historic Nostra Aetate.
  • Reverend Jean-Pierre Ruiz, D.S.T.: Associate Professor of Theology and Religious Studies, St. Johns University, and Past President of the Academy of Catholic Hispanic Theologians of the U.S.
ShortDesc: 2015 marks the 50th anniversary since the groundbreaking Vatican II Council and Nostra Aetate forever transformed Catholic-Jewish relations.
Title: 50 Years After Nostra Aetate: Catholic, Jewish & Latino Relations in the Age of a Latin American Pope

MobileDesc:
When two of the most influential forces in culinary culture take the stage, it’s a veritable foodie fantasy, not to mention the perfect recipe for great talk. With her 85th book, Martha Stewart’s Appetizers, Emmy Award-winning television show host and bestselling author Martha Stewart continues to revolutionize how America thinks about cooking, entertaining and home design. She joins James Beard Award-winning author and former Gourmet editor and New York Times food critic, Ruth Reichl, who is launching My Kitchen Year, her first new cookbook in forty years, this fall.

In the fall of 2009, the food world was rocked when Gourmet magazine was abruptly shuttered by its parent company. No one was more stunned by this unexpected turn of events than its beloved editor in chief, Ruth Reichl, who suddenly faced an uncertain professional future. As she struggled to process what had seemed unthinkable, Reichl turned to the one place that had always provided sanctuary. “I did what I always do when I’m confused, lonely, or frightened,” she writes. “I disappeared into the kitchen.”

The ticket and book option includes Martha Stewart's and Ruth Reichl's books.
ShortDesc: When two of the most influential forces in culinary culture take the stage, it’s a veritable foodie fantasy, not to mention the perfect recipe for great talk.
Title: Recipe for a Great Conversation: Martha Stewart and Ruth Reichl with Peter Elliot

MobileDesc:
“Brilliant, hilarious, and wondrously strange.¹”

“Like A Prairie Home Companion with LSD in its drinking water.²”

“Hypnotic and darkly funny.³”

Even if you’re the last person on the planet to get hooked on Welcome to Night Vale, you’ll want to be there when Joseph Fink and Jeffrey Cranor, co-creators of the #1 international hit podcast, sit down with Cecil Baldwin, the voice of Night Vale, to discuss their new novel and how it fits into the world of the podcast. Join them to hear more about this comedic, peculiar and poetic phenomenon.

Welcome to Night Vale is a twice-monthly podcast in the style of community updates for the small desert town of Night Vale, featuring local weather, news, announcements from the Sheriff's Secret Police, mysterious lights in the night sky, dark hooded figures with unknowable powers and cultural events. Turn on your radio and hide. Subscribe via iTunes or Stitcher or Libsyn or any podcast app or Soundcloud.

¹Random Riggs; ²Los Angeles Times; ³The Guardian
ShortDesc: Even if you’re the last person on the planet to get hooked on Welcome to Night Vale, you’ll want to be there when Joseph Fink and Jeffrey Cranor sit down with Cecil Baldwin to discuss their new novel and how it fits into the world of the podcast.
Title: Welcome To Night Vale: Joseph Fink, Jeffrey Cranor and Cecil Baldwin with Lev Grossman, moderator

MobileDesc: Bill George, Harvard University management professor and author of True North and Discover Your True North, moderates a panel of distinguished women including Barnard College's President Debora Spar and PepsiCo’s Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi to discuss the challenges women face in leadership today.
ShortDesc: Bill George, Harvard University management professor and author of True North and Discover Your True North, moderates a panel of distinguished women including Ursula M. Burns, Debora Spar and Indra Nooyi to discuss the challenges women face in leadership today.
Title: Women in Leadership: Ursula Burns, Debora Spar and Indra Nooyi with moderator Bill George

MobileDesc: Take a hilarious trip back to the ’90s with comedy star David Spade. The legendary Rock/Sandler/Farley era on “SNL.” The “Hollywood” Minute Sketches—and that Eddie Murphy story. The movies (Tommy Boy and Joe Dirt), the TV shows (“Just Shoot Me”)—they’re all in his new memoir, Almost Interesting, and tonight the actor and comedian talks about it all. With a wit as dry as the Arizona weather, David Spade reminds us what makes him one of our favorite funny people.
ShortDesc: Take a hilarious trip back to the ’90s with comedy star David Spade.
Title: David Spade in Conversation

MobileDesc: Jason Sudeikis and Alison Brie star as two romantic failures whose years of serial infidelity and self-sabotage have led them to swear that their relationship will remain strictly platonic. But can love still bloom while you’re sleeping with other people? Writer/director Leslye Headland’s (Bachelorette) sexy romantic comedy co-stars Amanda Peet, Adam Scott, and Natasha Lyonne.
ShortDesc: Jason Sudeikis and Alison Brie star as two romantic failures whose years of serial infidelity and self-sabotage have led them to swear that their relationship will remain strictly platonic.
Title: Sleeping with Other People: Preview Screening and Q+A with Jason Sudeikis, Alison Brie and Leslye Headland

MobileDesc: John Leguizamo’s 30-year career in show business has included turns in movies such as Chef, Ride Along, Romeo + Juliet, Moulin Rouge! and Carlito’s Way and onstage in five award-winning one-man shows. He talks about his early years in blue-collar Queens, his offstage life in love and marriage, his salvation through acting and writing and his colorful career trajectory. He’s the author of a new graphic novel, Ghetto Klown—a new adaptation of his award-winning Broadway play and HBO special.
ShortDesc: John Leguizamo’s 30-year career in show business has included turns in movies such as Chef, Ride Along, Romeo + Juliet, Moulin Rouge! and Carlito’s Way and onstage in five award-winning one-man shows.
Title: John Leguizamo in Conversation

MobileDesc: One of his generation’s most brilliant comic actors, the two-time Tony winner Nathan Lane joins us to talk about his life in theater, his recent triumphs as Theodore “Hickey” Hickman in The Iceman Cometh and as James Wicker in It’s Only a Play; family, friendship—and his delightful new picture book, Naughty Mabel, which comes out this fall. A book signing with his co-writer Devlin Elliott, follows the event.
ShortDesc: One of his generation’s most brilliant comic actors, the two-time Tony winner Nathan Lane joins us to talk about his life in theater.
Title: Nathan Lane in Conversation

MobileDesc: We always knew Rep. Steve Israel had a funny side, but last December he “revealed his inner Jon Stewart,” according to the New York Daily News, with his novel The Global War on Morris. A Buckleyesque satire on the Bush Cheney era, it’s now in development for a comedy series for cable. Israel is joined by MSNBC host Chris Matthews to discuss the absurdities of Washington—as only insiders like these two can.
ShortDesc: We always knew Rep. Steve Israel had a funny side, but last December he “revealed his inner Jon Stewart,” according to the New York Daily News, with his novel The Global War on Morris.
Title: Politics and Pundits: Congressman Steve Israel with Chris Matthews

MobileDesc: Music icons Emilio and Gloria Estefan are Broadway bound as they bring their story of true love and international success to the stage. Join them to hear about On Your Feet! The Musical—opening at the Marquis Theatre in October—the story of their life, their 36-year-old marriage and their love—for each other, for America and for music.
ShortDesc: Music icons Emilio and Gloria Estefan are Broadway bound as they bring their story of true love and international success to the stage.
Title: Gloria and Emilio Estefan in Conversation

MobileDesc: On stage and screen, Judith Light makes interesting choices playing complicated and intriguing women. Her latest role is the ex-wife of Mort/Maura in Amazon Prime’s groundbreaking series, “Transparent,” which is getting rave reviews and has already won a Golden Globe. Join her as she discusses her hot new series and how it reflects the landscape we’re living in—as well as a career playing some remarkable women.
ShortDesc: On stage and screen, Judith Light makes interesting choices playing complicated and intriguing women.
Title: Judith Light in Conversation

MobileDesc: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater grew from a now-fabled performance in March 1958 at 92nd Street Y. Led by Alvin Ailey and a group of young African-American modern dancers, that performance changed forever the perception of American dance. The Ailey Company has gone on to perform for an estimated 25 million people at theaters in 48 states and 71 countries on six continents—as well as millions more through television broad-casts. Hear from artistic director Robert Battle and other guests about their unique history, their exciting upcoming season and the company’s remarkable journey.
ShortDesc: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater grew from a now-fabled performance in March 1958 at 92nd Street Y.
Title: Celebrating Alvin Ailey: Robert Battle with Budd Mishkin

MobileDesc: We know George Takei for his role as "Star Trek"’s Mr. Sulu, and for his 8.6 million Facebook followers, and for his LGBT advocacy—but when he was a child, he and his family were forced from their Los Angeles home into an internment camp for Japanese Americans thousands of miles away in the swamps of Arkansas, as a “security” measure during World War II. Hear how his story has become the inspiration for Allegiance, the new Broadway musical in which Takei also stars, as he talks with Jujamcyn Theaters president and owner Jordan Roth.
ShortDesc: We know George Takei for his role as "Star Trek"’s Mr. Sulu, and for his 8.6 million Facebook followers, and for his LGBT advocacy—but when he was a child, he and his family were forced from their Los Angeles home into an internment camp for Japanese Americans.
Title: George Takei with Jordan Roth

MobileDesc: He fronted the snarling, cross-dressing protopunk band the New York Dolls. Then morphed into the martini-swigging R&B-crooning artist Buster Poindexter. For 50 years, David Johansen has lived a life in music and, “with his exaggerated pompadour, crocodile grin, and raw Tom Waits growl, he’s still having the time of his life,” wrote The New York Times’ Stephen Holden after one of his recent Café Carlyle shows. Hear about it all, as David Johansen, known as “the world’s foremost ethnomusicologist” talks with NY1’s Budd Mishkin.
ShortDesc: He fronted the snarling, cross-dressing protopunk band the New York Dolls. Then morphed into the martini-swigging R&B-crooning artist Buster Poindexter.
Title: The Evolution of David Johansen”  David Johansen in conversation with Budd Mishkin

MobileDesc: What gets Elvis Duran up in the morning? The legendary radio host sits down with FOX 5’s “Good Day New York” co-host Rosanna Scotto for an in-depth discussion about his 30-year career and the path that led him to his position as host of the #1 Top 40 radio show in the US. Hear his favorite celebrity stories and get the inside scoop on what drives him and continues to make him compulsory listening for millions of listeners all over the nation.
ShortDesc: What gets Elvis Duran up in the morning?
Title: Elvis Duran in Conversation with Rosanna Scotto

MobileDesc:
James Naughton's remarkable career has won him two Tony Awards—as Best Actor in a Musical, for his noir-ish private eye in 1990's City of Angels, and as the fast-talking, silver-tongued lawyer Billy Flynn in the long-running revival of the musical Chicago. On film, his roles have seen him portray a variety of characters ranging from one of law professor John Houseman's harried undergrads in The Paper Chase, to the neglected spouse of Meryl Streep in The Devil Wears Prada. Equally respected as a director, he has brought to the stage such productions as Arthur Miller's The Price, and the Thornton Wilder classic Our Town starring Paul Newman.

James Naughton will direct and host Battle of the Airwaves! in the new Lyrics and Lyricists season.
ShortDesc: James Naughton's remarkable career has won him two Tony Awards—as Best Actor in a Musical, for his noir-ish private eye in 1990's City of Angels, and as the fast-talking, silver-tongued lawyer Billy Flynn in the long-running revival of the musical Chicago.
Title: Tony Vellela Talks Theater with James Naughton

MobileDesc: The creative force behind American rock band Creedence Clearwater Revival, John Fogerty wrote, sang and produced their instantly recognizable classics “Proud Mary,” “Bad Moon Rising,” “Born in the Bayou” and more. Join him as he discusses his new memoir, Fortunate Son: My Life, My Music, and hear about his epic journey from his Northern California roots, CCR’s incredible success in the ’60s and ’70s, his retreat from music and public life to his hard-won revival as a solo artist who finally found love.
ShortDesc: The creative force behind American rock band Creedence Clearwater Revival, John Fogerty wrote, sang and produced their instantly recognizable classics “Proud Mary,” “Bad Moon Rising,” “Born in the Bayou” and more.
Title: Creedence Clearwater Revival’s John Fogerty in Conversation

MobileDesc: The award-winning creator and organizer of Fashion Week in New York and cities across the globe, Fern Mallis has been an industry game changer in the world of fashion and design for more than 35 years. A former senior vice president of IMG Fashion and executive director of CFDA, she is the author of Fashion Lives: Fashion Icons with Fern Mallis, published by Rizzoli, which features no-holds-barred interviews, combined with never-before-seen personal photographs from interviewees such as Tom Ford, Marc Jacobs, Calvin Klein, Donna Karan, Michael Kors, Tommy Hilfiger, Betsey Johnson, Polly Mellen, Bruce Weber and more.  She is currently the president of her own leading international fashion and design consultancy, Fern Mallis LLC.
ShortDesc: The award-winning creator and organizer of Fashion Week in New York and cities across the globe, Fern Mallis has been an industry game changer in the world of fashion and design for 32 years.
Title: Fashion Icons with Fern Mallis: Iman

MobileDesc: One of the original supermodels, Cindy Crawford defined that pivotal moment when fashion models became cultural stars. In her new book, Becoming, Cindy combines over 150 of her most iconic images with essays that highlight the lessons learned along the way. Join Cindy Crawford and Fern Mallis as this fashion legend shares her journey—finding the courage to leave her small home town, learning to say no and overcome fears, explaining the art of modeling and how some of the biggest fashion photographers helped shape her and her thoughts on body image and aging. A book signing follows.
ShortDesc: One of the original supermodels, Cindy Crawford defined that pivotal moment when fashion models became cultural stars.
Title: A Fashion Icons Book Launch Event: Interview with Cindy Crawford

MobileDesc: After being temporarily booted off Facebook for posting art historical images that “didn’t quite mesh with the social networking site’s regulations” (ARTNews), Jerry Saltz, New York magazine’s outrageous and influential art critic, joins us for what’s sure to be a spirited talk. He’ll address the ways in which artists, critics and curators push the limits of humor, irony, decency and performance as well as the audience’s willingness to tolerate or accept those provocations. There’ll be an “Ask Jerry” segment at the end.
ShortDesc: After being temporarily booted off Facebook for posting art historical images that “didn’t quite mesh with the social networking site’s regulations” (ARTNews), Jerry Saltz, New York magazine’s outrageous and influential art critic, joins us for what’s sure to be a spirited talk.
Title: An Evening with Jerry Saltz

MobileDesc: Join legendary art connoisseur and Picasso biographer Sir John Richardson and his collaborator Gijs van Hensbergen for a lively discussion about Picasso’s life and work. Richardson’s extensive writings include A Life of Picasso, Volumes I, II & III (with Volume IV in process); Sacred Monsters, Sacred Masters; The Sorcerer’s Apprentice; and more. Gijs van Hensbergen is the author of God’s Architect, a biography of Antonio Gaudi and Guernica: The Biography of a Twentieth-century Icon.
ShortDesc: Join legendary art connoisseur and Picasso biographer Sir John Richardson and his collaborator Gijs van Hensbergen for a lively discussion about Picasso’s life and work.
Title: Sir John Richardson and Gijs van Hensbergen: On Picasso

MobileDesc:
Don McCullin is one of the great photographers of our time. His iconic images of conflict and social breakdown have made him a household name, recognized internationally. The winner of multiple awards, he’s exhibited all over the world to constant acclaim, found most recently in his landscape and social documentation work. He talks with the award winning international correspondent Sebastian Junger, whose acclaimed book War and documentary Restrepo cast a visceral eye to the reality of conflict. How has their work on the frontlines affected them? What inspires and drives their work today?

A book signing will follow.
ShortDesc: Don McCullin is one of the great photographers of our time.
Title: Don McCullin with Sebastian Junger

MobileDesc: Art critic and historian Irving Sandler has provided first-hand accounts of modern American art, beginning with Abstract Expressionism in the 1950s, when he managed the Tanager Gallery and coordinated the New York artists’ ZT Club of the New York School. His new memoir, Swept Up by Art, chronicles his life and involvement in the art world since the ’70s. Phong Bui is an artist, writer and curator, as well as the co-founder, editor-in-chief and publisher of the Brooklyn Rail.
ShortDesc: Art critic and historian Irving Sandler has provided first-hand accounts of modern American art, beginning with Abstract Expressionism in the 1950s, when he managed the Tanager Gallery and coordinated the New York artists’ ZT Club of the New York School.
Title: Irving Sandler with Phong Bui

MobileDesc: No one has a better idea than Silver, whose accurate predictions stunned the media in the two previous election cycles. Get Nate’s perspective on the current political climate and what to look for in the upcoming election.
ShortDesc: No one has a better idea than Silver, whose accurate predictions stunned the media in the two previous election cycles. Get Nate’s perspective on the current political climate and what to look for in the upcoming election.
Title: Nate Silver and Guests: Election 2016 by the Numbers

MobileDesc: When commentators of the caliber of syndicated columnist Mark Shields and The New York Times op-ed columnist David Brooks get together to discuss today’s major issues, you know you’re in for an illuminating and stimulating evening. The PBS “NewsHour” sparring partners will present their views, analyze the day’s news and maybe even make a prediction or two on the outcomes of election 2016.
ShortDesc: When commentators of the caliber of syndicated columnist Mark Shields and The New York Times op-ed columnist David Brooks get together to discuss today’s major issues, you know you’re in for an illuminating and stimulating evening.
Title: David Brooks and Mark Shields

MobileDesc: The Pulitzer Prize-winning historian discusses his new biography of the 41st president, Destiny and Power with ABC News “This Week” host and chief anchor George Stephanopoulos. Based on private interviews and extraordinary access to Bush’s diaries and to his family, Meacham traces the life of the president. During his single term, Bush managed the end of the Cold War, the reunification of Germany and the expulsion of Iraq from Kuwait. Join us to explore his life and legacy.
ShortDesc: The Pulitzer Prize-winning historian discusses his new biography of the 41st president, Destiny and Power with ABC News “This Week” host and chief anchor George Stephanopoulos.
Title: Jon Meacham in Conversation with George Stephanopoulos

MobileDesc: Few people know more about politics than Bob Schieffer, the Washington insider who’s been on a first-name basis with key DC figures for decades. A member of the Rat Pack of broadcast journalism’s halcyon years (along with Walter Cronkite, Tom Brokaw, Peter Jennings and Dan Rather), Bob Schieffer has held every major job at CBS News. He’s moderated presidential debates, anchored the network news, written bestselling books and survived cancer. His show, “Face the Nation,” which this year celebrated its 60th anniversary, still sits atop the ratings. Join him in the run-up to the Iowa caucuses, as he begins a Harvard fellowship focused on the 2016 election, for his expert take on today’s news, and what’s going on behind the headlines.
ShortDesc: Few people know more about politics than Bob Schieffer, the Washington insider who’s been on a first-name basis with key DC figures for decades.
Title: Bob Schieffer in Conversation with Norah O'Donnell

MobileDesc: Peggy Noonan—one of our most astute political commentators and a speechwriter for the Reagan White House—is not known for mincing words. Join her for a thoroughly candid, clear-thinking and well-articulated discussion on the issues, the prospects and the candidates for election 2016.
ShortDesc: Peggy Noonan—one of our most astute political commentators and a speechwriter for the Reagan White House—is not known for mincing words.
Title: Peggy Noonan in Conversation

MobileDesc: When Ted Koppel issues a warning, you listen. The ABC News veteran who’s won every significant TV award (including 42 Emmys) tells us that a major cyber attack on America’s power grid is not only possible, but likely. Such an attack would be devastating—potentially leaving us without power for weeks or months. Scarier still is his revelation that the US is shockingly unprepared: the Department of Homeland Security has no plan for handling the aftermath of an attack. Join one of our most renowned journalists to examine the reality of the threat—and ways we can prepare for catastrophe, as outlined in his new book, Lights Out.
ShortDesc: When Ted Koppel issues a warning, you listen. The ABC News veteran who’s won every significant TV award (including 42 Emmys) tells us that a major cyber attack on America’s power grid is not only possible, but likely.
Title: Ted Koppel in Conversation with Charlie Rose: Lights Out: A Cyberattack, A Nation Unprepared, Surviving the Aftermath

MobileDesc: Director Alex Gibney has been called “the most important documentarian of our time” (Esquire). His collaboration with Pulitzer Prize-winning author Lawrence Wright has resulted in cinematic, gripping and deeply insightful documentaries including Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief, which was one of the most watched HBO documentaries of the past decade, and My Trip to Al-Qaeda, based on Lawrence’s bestselling book, The Looming Tower. They’ll discuss speaking truth to power with Hollywood Reporter and Billboard’s Janice Min.
ShortDesc: Director Alex Gibney has been called “the most important documentarian of our time” (Esquire).
Title: Alex Gibney and Lawrence Wright with Janice Min, moderator
