MobileDesc: “Good Morning America” anchor Amy Robach was enjoying a successful career when in November 2013 she agreed to have a live, televised mammography in Times Square to raise awareness for breast cancer. Little did she know she’d be embarking on the most difficult journey of her life. Join her as she shares stories about the people she’s met in her career and her new memoir, Better: How I Let Go of Control, Held Onto Hope, and Found Joy in My Darkest Hour. She’ll speak candidly about how her illness impacted her family life and her marriage, tapped into her deepest fears and strengths, and transformed her in ways she never could have imagined.
ShortDesc: “Good Morning America” anchor Amy Robach was enjoying a successful career when in November 2013 she agreed to have a live, televised mammography in Times Square to raise awareness for breast cancer.
Title: Amy Robach in Conversation

MobileDesc: They’re from opposite sides of the aisle, but equally expert when it comes to setting the record straight on Israel: Dennis Ross, who has been a direct participant in shaping US policy towards Israel and the Middle East for nearly 30 years—first in the George H. W. Bush administration, then as Bill Clinton’s Middle East Peace envoy, and then as a special assistant to the president under Barack Obama. His new book is Doomed to Succeed. Alan Dershowitz has been a consultant to several presidential commissions and has advised presidents, UN officials, prime ministers, governors, senators and members of Congress. His latest book is The Case Against The Iran Deal: How Can We Now Stop Iran from Getting Nukes? Ethan Bronner, senior editor for international news at Bloomberg, moderates.
ShortDesc: They’re from opposite sides of the aisle, but equally expert when it comes to setting the record straight on Israel.
Title: Dennis Ross & Alan Dershowitz with Ethan Bronner: The US-Israel Relationship from Truman to Obama—and What’s Next for the Middle East

MobileDesc: Historian Niall Ferguson’s definitive new biography of Henry Kissinger—the single most important strategic thinker America has ever produced—is one of the most anticipated books of the fall. Join him and hear why Ferguson—after unprecedented access to Kissinger’s private papers and more than 100 archives around the world—considers him to be far from the ruthless arch-realist he’s frequently considered to be; but rather, an idealist; and in so doing, recasts the cold war world.
ShortDesc: Historian Niall Ferguson’s definitive new biography of Henry Kissinger—the single most important strategic thinker America has ever produced—is one of the most anticipated books of the fall.
Title: Niall Ferguson on Henry Kissinger

MobileDesc: You’re never too young to make a difference. That’s the message in Chelsea Clinton’s inspiring and motivational first book for young readers. Sharing the passion she’s had since childhood, Chelsea breaks down some of the world’s biggest challenges and tells inspiring stories of young people who are already making an impact on their own communities and around the globe. A book signing will follow the event.
ShortDesc: You’re never too young to make a difference.
Title: Chelsea Clinton: It’s Your World: Get Informed, Get inspired & Get Going!

MobileDesc: With The Selfish Gene, Richard Dawkins helped steer evolutionary science into the 21st century. The God Delusion catapulted him to intellectual stardom and celebrity. Polemical in his attack upon religion as an explanation of his world, he is funny, outrageous, wise and enlightening—often simultaneously. He’s just written a new memoir—Brief Candle in the Dark—and is joined by “Radiolab’s” Robert Krulwich to look back on a lifetime of tireless intellectual adventure and engagement. A book signing follows this event.
ShortDesc: With The Selfish Gene, Richard Dawkins helped steer evolutionary science into the 21st century.
Title: Richard Dawkins in Conversation with Robert Krulwich

MobileDesc: “Beard’s popularizing bent is grounded in a deep knowledge of the arcane, and she gives new insight into the hoariest of topics,” wrote Rebecca Mead in The New Yorker. This fall, the Cambridge Professor launches S.P.Q.R., A History of Ancient Rome, with massive fanfare. Come discover why celebrities turn up to her book events, why she’s considered one of the world’s foremost classicists and why, after hearing her speak, you’ll never think of Julius Caesar, Cicero or Nero in the same way again.
ShortDesc: “Beard’s popularizing bent is grounded in a deep knowledge of the arcane, and she gives new insight into the hoariest of topics,” wrote Rebecca Mead in The New Yorker.
Title: Mary Beard on Ancient Rome

MobileDesc: Just as he showed us how irrationality steers our decision-making, superstar behavioral economist Dan Ariely reveals that none of us is immune to cheating. Join the subject of the acclaimed new documentary (Dis)Honesty – The Truth About Lies and New York Times bestselling author of Predictably Irrational and The Honest Truth about Dishonesty for a brilliantly revealing talk.
ShortDesc: Just as he showed us how irrationality steers our decision-making, superstar behavioral economist Dan Ariely reveals that none of us is immune to cheating.
Title: Dan Ariely and the Honest Truth about Dishonesty

MobileDesc: The first female theoretical physicist tenured at Harvard, Lisa Randall makes ideas like string theory and quantum mechanics accessible to the rest of us in bestselling books like Knocking on Heaven’s Door and Warped Passages. Now, she’s onto something new: dark matter—and evidence of how it may be interacting with matter here on earth. For cosmologists, this is sensational. Bill Nye joins Randall to discuss the ideas in her new book, Dark Matter and the Dinosaurs. A book signing follows this event.
ShortDesc: The first female theoretical physicist tenured at Harvard, Lisa Randall makes ideas like string theory and quantum mechanics accessible to the rest of us in bestselling books like Knocking on Heaven’s Door and Warped Passages.
Title: Lisa Randall and Bill Nye the Science Guy

MobileDesc:
Rabbi Lord Jonathan Sacks, one of the most admired religious leaders of our time delivers a major address on how we can understand and confront religious violence. In his powerful and timely new book, Not in God’s Name, Rabbi Sacks tackles the phenomenon of religious extremism. If religion is perceived to be part of the problem, he argues, then it must also form part of the solution. To do this, according to Rabbi Sacks, you first have to understand the concept of “altruistic evil”, of violence committed in the name of God. It is only by understanding our collective past that we will be able to build a better future, one where the three Abrahamic monotheisms—Judaism, Christianity and Islam—exist side-by-side in peace.

Don’t miss the opportunity to hear this major address by one of the world’s most highly regarded faith leaders.

A book signing will follow the event.
ShortDesc: Rabbi Lord Jonathan Sacks, one of the most admired religious leaders of our time delivers a major address on how we can understand and confront religious violence.
Title: Rabbi Lord Jonathan Sacks: Not in God’s Name—Confronting Religious Violence

MobileDesc: Harold Kushner, the author of When Bad Things Happen to Good People and 13 other landmark books, including a new title, Nine Essential Things I’ve Learned About Life, is joined by Rachel Cowan, author of Wise Aging, for what is sure to be an inspiring and uplifting discussion about what it means to live a good life.
ShortDesc: Harold Kushner is joined by Rachel Cowan for what is sure to be an inspiring and uplifting discussion about what it means to live a good life.
Title: Harold S. Kushner and Rachel Cowan with Peter J. Rubinstein: Living Well, Aging Well

MobileDesc: Join former NBC newsman and “Meet the Press” moderator David Gregory and religious scholar Erica Brown as they discuss issues of faith, identity and leadership in your personal and professional life. David Gregory’s new book is How’s Your Faith?. Erica Brown is the author of Take Your Soul to Work.
ShortDesc: Join former NBC newsman and “Meet the Press” moderator David Gregory and religious scholar Erica Brown as they discuss issues of faith, identity and leadership in your personal and professional life.
Title: David Gregory and Erica Brown with Peter J. Rubinstein

MobileDesc:
“This non-fiction film reminiscent of Schindler's List is that rare Holocaust documentary that is as uplifting as it is moving.” –The Hollywood Reporter

Would you risk your life to save a stranger? My Italian Secret is the untold saga of Italians like Gino Bartali (voiced by Oscar-nominated actor Robert Loggia), the charismatic Italian cycling hero who risked his life over and over to save innocent lives. The film is directed and written by Oscar-nominated filmmaker Oren Jacoby, and narrated by Isabella Rossellini. After the screening, survivors from Italy will relay their own experiences in a conversation moderated by Joy Behar, the Daytime Emmy Award-winner and one of the original co-hosts of ABC’s “The View.”
ShortDesc: Would you risk your life to save a stranger? My Italian Secret is the untold saga of Italians who rescued Jews and other refugees fleeing the Nazis in World War II.
Title: My Italian Secret: The Forgotten Heroes—Film Screening and Discussion

MobileDesc: This comedy-drama starring Tom Hanks, Melanie Griffith and Bruce Willis explores the mix of ambition, racism, politics and greed in 1980s New York, when being a Master of the Universe defined the very meaning of Wall Street excess and entitlement. Twenty-five years on, Tom Wolfe reflects on the novel and film, and United States Attorney Preet Bharara offers his view on its continued relevance.
ShortDesc: This comedy-drama starring Tom Hanks, Melanie Griffith and Bruce Willis explores the mix of ambition, racism, politics and greed in 1980s New York, when being a Master of the Universe defined the very meaning of Wall Street excess and entitlement.
Title: The Bonfire of the Vanities: Tom Wolfe and Preet Bharara with Thane Rosenbaum

MobileDesc: Chef, restaurateur, bestselling author and TV star Bobby Flay is renowned for his skills at the grill, but since 2010 he has also been sharing his other passion with television viewers: brunch. He’ll dish about his favorite meal with New York Times food critic Sam Sifton, timed to the publication of Flay’s latest book, Brunch @ Bobby’s. Join us as the two talk shop and delve into Flay’s delicious takes on brunch classics from lip-smacking cocktails to pancakes and pastries.
ShortDesc: Chef, restaurateur, bestselling author and TV star Bobby Flay is renowned for his skills at the grill, but since 2010 he has also been sharing his other passion with television viewers: brunch.
Title: Bobby Flay and Sam Sifton: The “Throwdown” Star Serves It Up

MobileDesc: Jacques Pépin is one of the world’s most revered chefs whose upcoming book reveals his most cherished recipes for cooking at home. Anthony Bourdain is the gourmand gadfly whose hit show, “Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown,” takes viewers on food adventures often as far from home as can be imagined. Together, they’ll tantalize our taste buds as Pépin celebrates his 80th birthday and the airing of his final PBS show, “Jacques Pépin: Heart & Soul,” to which his new book is a companion.
ShortDesc: Jacques Pépin is one of the world’s most revered chefs whose upcoming book reveals his most cherished recipes for cooking at home.
Title: Jacques Pépin and Anthony Bourdain: Home and Away

MobileDesc: International phenomenon and New York Times bestselling author Yotam Ottolenghi returns to 92Y to talk about his highly anticipated collection of recipes from his blockbuster London restaurant NOPI. He’s joined by NOPI’s head chef Ramael Scully, whose Asian roots collide with Ottolenghi’s Middle Eastern influences to create gorgeous dishes.
ShortDesc: International phenomenon and New York Times bestselling author Yotam Ottolenghi returns to 92Y to talk about his highly anticipated collection of recipes from his blockbuster London restaurant NOPI.
Title: Yotam Ottolenghi and Ramael Scully with Sam Kass

MobileDesc: Nigella Lawson changed the way we think—and feel—about home cooking. Witty, ironic, authentic, she made bak-ing sexy and brought glamour to the family dinner table. Her books—which include How to Be a Domestic Goddess, Forever Summer and Nigella Bites—have sold more than 3 million copies worldwide. She’s a mentor and Judge on ABC’s “The Taste” and is bringing out her new book, Simply Nigella, this fall. Join Nigella in person to hear her inspiring and practical ideas for incorporating delicious food into our daily lives without any stress.
ShortDesc: Nigella Lawson changed the way we think—and feel—about home cooking.
Title: Simply Nigella: Nigella Lawson with Gabrielle Hamilton

MobileDesc:
Join David Darst and moderator Claire B. Benenson on a conversation about financial strategy and investment.

We will discuss:

  • The effects of Federal Reserve Policy, Economic Developments in China, Oil Price Trends and  Foreign Exchange Movements in the U.S. Dollar on Asset Prices in developed and emerging market equities, fixed income securities, real estate, commodities, precious metals and other asset categories.
  • The outlook for the U.S. and the global economy, inflation/deflation and corporate profits.
  • The influence of political, social and geopolitical trends on society and the economy.
ShortDesc: Join David Darst and moderator Claire B. Benenson on a conversation about financial strategy and investment.
Title: David Darst with Claire B. Benenson: Asset Allocation and Investment Strategy for 2016 and Beyond

MobileDesc: Global Markets Institute president Abby Joseph Cohen will offer practical advice for the individual investor in making informed decisions and understanding today’s markets.
ShortDesc: Global Markets Institute president Abby Joseph Cohen will offer practical advice for the individual investor in making informed decisions and understanding today’s markets.
Title: Abby Joseph Cohen with Madeline Noveck

MobileDesc:
This is the launch event for Queen of Shadows, the fourth novel in the Throne of Glass series. A book signing will take place after the event.

Purchase of Queen of Shadows is required to join signing line. Signing is limited to 3 books per person.
ShortDesc: This is the launch event for Queen of Shadows, the fourth novel in the Throne of Glass series.
Title: YA Lit at 92Y: Sarah J. Maas—Queen of Shadows in Conversation with Sasha Alsberg

MobileDesc: Master storyteller David Baldacci, whose new YA title is The Keeper, joins the bestselling partnership Cassandra Clare and Holly Black to discuss the new volume in their Magisterium collaboration, The Copper Gauntlet.
ShortDesc: Master storyteller David Baldacci, whose new YA title is The Keeper, joins the bestselling partnership Cassandra Clare and Holly Black to discuss the new volume in their Magisterium collaboration, The Copper Gauntlet.
Title: David Baldacci, Cassandra Clare and Holly Black

MobileDesc: The rise of China will be a key issue in the election and pose challenges to the United States for decades to come. What is the current state of US-China relations and how should a new administration handle our complex relationship with Beijing? Join two leading foreign policy experts for a penetrating discussion about the future course of the United States and China and the role foreign policy will have in the choice of our next leader.
ShortDesc: The rise of China will be a key issue in the election and pose challenges to the United States for decades to come.
Title: The Big Issues: US-China Relations and Foreign Policy

MobileDesc: George Gershwin traveled to Paris in 1928, intent on composing a new orchestral piece. The result: “An American in Paris,” his first for orchestra alone, with no part included for himself as piano soloist. Some consider this piece to be his orchestral masterpiece. Our lecture explores the work in context of the modernist trends of the 1920’s, via vintage and contemporary recordings, including an eye-opening version for two pianos.
ShortDesc: George Gershwin traveled to Paris in 1928, intent on composing a new orchestral piece.
Title: Behind the Music with Louis Rosen: An American in Paris

MobileDesc:
For more than 15 years, 92Y audiences have relished the clarity and thoughtfulness Professor Ralph Buultjens brings to discussions of foreign affairs. Drawing on his vast knowledge and understanding of how conflicts in one part of the world affect peace in another, Buultjens offers insight you can’t find anywhere else. We are thrilled to bring Professor Buultjens’ lecture series in its entirety to our 92Y Live partner organizations for the first time ever.

Please note: Due to the fast-changing nature of international events, topics may change. We will keep 92Y Live customers informed of any such changes and can adjust sessions if necessary.
ShortDesc: For more than 15 years, 92Y audiences have relished the clarity and thoughtfulness Professor Ralph Buultjens brings to discussions of foreign affairs.
Title: World Politics with Ralph Buultjens: The Far East—China vs Japan

MobileDesc:
Join the star chef, founder and co-owner of the wildly popular restaurant Mission Chinese Food to hear about his riotous new book that’s packed with recipes that embody his signature mash-up of “Chinese” food and American classics. Hear how the restaurant was born out of a food truck that roamed the late-night streets of San Francisco’s Mission District—about Bowien’s ill-fated trip to China, and his ultimate success as a restaurateur in SF and NYC.

Danny Bowien will be signing copies of his book, The Mission Chinese Food Cookbook, following the event.
ShortDesc: Join the star chef, founder and co-owner of the wildly popular restaurant Mission Chinese Food to hear about his riotous new book that’s packed with recipes that embody his signature mash-up of “Chinese” food and American classics.
Title: Mission Chinese Food with Danny Bowien

MobileDesc:
At the annual National Book Awards Teen Press Conference, middle and high school students from New York City’s public and private schools play the role of reporters as they direct questions to the five Finalists for the 2015 National Book Award in Young People's Literature. Participating schools will receive a copy of one of the finalist’s books.

Limited Availability. Call for tickets 212.415.5576
ShortDesc: At the annual National Book Awards Teen Press Conference, middle and high school students from New York City’s public and private schools play the role of reporters as they direct questions to the five Finalists for the 2015 National Book Award in Young People's Literature.
Title: Read Aloud: National Book Award Teen Press Conference

MobileDesc:
Born in May 1968 in Switzerland, Hans Ulrich Obrist is widely regarded as the most experimental and unconventional curator of his generation and is credited with radically altering the traditional understanding of exhibition-making. Rethinking the display of art, questioning the role and function of museums, and deconstructing the concept of exhibitions, Obrist has staged shows in his kitchen, in a hotel room and on top of a mountain, and has worked with artists to explore the ways in which art intersects with other fields such as science, architecture, theater and literature. Obrist is also known for his Interview Project for which he has conducted over 300 interviews with artists, scientists, filmmakers and writers since the early 1990s. He has published over 100 books in the last two decades. His most recent book, Ways of Curating (2014), is an account of his own development as one of the most thoughtful and creative thinkers in the art world today. He sits down with the Jewish Museum’s Jens Hoffmann, Deputy Director, Exhibitions and Public Programs and co-curator of the exhibition Unorthodox, to discuss the development and history of curating, highlighting some of Obrist’s most challenging exhibitions and examining historical examples of radical curatorial practices that have emerged over the last 40 years.

Unorthodox Exhibitions is part of a series of programs that will take place both at the Jewish Museum and at 92nd Street Y in conjunction with the exhibition Unorthodox, on view at the Jewish Museum November 6, 2015 through March 27, 2016. The show presents over 50 artists from around the world whose practices mix forms and genres without concern for artistic conventions. The accompanying public programs—which also include “Unorthodox Artists” (November 2015) and “Unorthodox Museums” (March 2016)—investigate the same notion of defying cultural and artistic uniformity. Join us for a unique behind-the-scenes Talk and Tour with curators Jens Hoffmann, Daniel S. Palmer and Kelly Taxter on Nov 10 at 10 am.
ShortDesc: Born in May 1968 in Switzerland, Hans Ulrich Obrist is widely regarded as the most experimental and unconventional curator of his generation and is credited with radically altering the traditional understanding of exhibition-making.
Title: Unorthodox Exhibitions: Hans Ulrich Obrist and Jens Hoffmann

MobileDesc: Graphic designer Milton Glaser, known for iconic work including the “I Love New York” logo and co-founding New York magazine, in conversation with New York design editor Wendy Goodman.
ShortDesc: Graphic designer Milton Glaser, known for iconic work including the “I Love New York” logo and co-founding New York magazine, in conversation with New York design editor Wendy Goodman.
Title: Milton Glaser in Conversation with Wendy Goodman

MobileDesc: With fifty years in public service, Ray Kelly is one of the world’s most highly esteemed law enforcement leaders. He’s the two-term police commissioner who, in the wake of the 9/11 attacks, transformed the NYPD into a counter-terrorism force to surpass even the FBI and the Pentagon. Hear about a life fighting crime and the dozens of sinister plots foiled by his antiterrorist teams—as well as his take on the challenges and issues facing police officers and police agencies in the USA today. Justice, integrity, courage, loyalty—these are the values that propelled him through the ranks of the NYPD during the city’s toughest decades, and continue to drive him today. A book signing of his new memoir, Vigilance, follows the event.
ShortDesc: With fifty years in public service, Ray Kelly is one of the world’s most highly esteemed law enforcement leaders.
Title: Ray Kelly in Conversation with Dan Abrams

MobileDesc: Top Israeli espionage expert Michael Bar-Zohar is joined by Pulitzer Prize-winning investigative journalist Judith Miller for a riveting look inside the most daring and white-knuckle missions of the Israeli Special Forces, as told in his new book, No Mission Is Impossible. They spotlight some of the soldiers and top commanders from Israel’s past and present—including Ariel Sharon, Ehud Barak, the brothers Netanyahu, and others—who made them happen, revealing the skill, strength and incredible courage of the men and women behind these crucial missions that shaped Israel and the world at large. They will also address the role of the Mossad, the subject of Mr. Bar-Zohar's previous bestselling book, Mossad: The Greatest Missions of the Israel Secret Service.
ShortDesc: Top Israeli espionage expert Michael Bar-Zohar is joined by Pulitzer Prize-winning investigative journalist Judith Miller for a riveting look inside the most daring and white-knuckle missions of the Israeli Special Forces, as told in his new book, No Mission Is Impossible.
Title: Michael Bar-Zohar in Conversation with Judith Miller: Inside the Death-Defying Missions of the Israeli Special Forces

MobileDesc:
The “coolest person on TV right now” (Refinery 29) joins us to talk about her new book, Why Not Me? which, from the sound of it, is going to be as insightful and funny and revealing as her first brilliant, bestselling memoir, Is Everyone Hanging Out Without Me (and Other Concerns). Focusing on the past five years, this deeply personal and funny collection of essays talks about “The Office” and “The Mindy Project;” her relationship with B. J. Novak (“it’s as weird as hell”); attempting to be the first person in history to lose weight without any behavior modification whatsoever; the difficulties of finding a good female friend; and believing you have a place in Hollywood when you’re constantly reminded that no one looks like you. Don’t miss the opportunity to get up close and personal with this actor, writer, producer and director who is one of the funniest and most creative people around today.

Each ticket includes a pre-signed copy of Mindy Kaling’s new book Why Not Me?
ShortDesc: The “coolest person on TV right now” (Refinery 29) joins us to talk about her new book, Why Not Me? which, from the sound of it, is going to be as insightful and funny and revealing as her first brilliant, bestselling memoir, Is Everyone Hanging Out Without Me (and Other Concerns).
Title: Mindy Kaling in Conversation with Tina Fey

MobileDesc: Actor/comedian/author Michael Ian Black ("Wet Hot American Summer" on Netflix; "Another Period" on Comedy Central) and author and comedian Sara Benincasa discuss growing up as East Coast kids, adventures or lack thereof in Washington, DC, and the perils and pleasures of writing a book.
ShortDesc: Actor/comedian/author Michael Ian Black ("Wet Hot American Summer" on Netflix; "Another Period" on Comedy Central) and author and comedian Sara Benincasa discuss growing up as East Coast kids, adventures or lack thereof in Washington, DC, and the perils and pleasures of writing a book.
Title: Sara Benincasa In Conversation with Michael Ian Black

MobileDesc:
The ground breaking humor magazine National Lampoon was published from it's New York City headquarters from 1970-1988 which encompasses both some of the city's most beloved and troubled eras. The story of the National Lampoon is being told in Douglas Tirola's much anticipated documentary Drunk Stoned Brilliant Dead which was a hit at this year's Sundance and Tribeca Film Festivals. Writers and artists from The Lampoon will discuss working for the magazine in New York City during this period as well as read and show work that dealt with and was influenced by the city—down to finding nude models on 42nd Street. Join us on Sep 10 to see NYC through the unique comedic genius that is the National Lampoon.

Drunk Stoned Brilliant Dead: The Story of the National Lampoon will be released by Magnolia Pictures on September 25.
ShortDesc: Join us on Sep 10 to see NYC through the unique comedic genius that is the National Lampoon.
Title: DRUNK STONED BRILLIANT DEAD: The National Lampoon in New York City 1970-1988

MobileDesc: In her new deeply personal and sometimes provocative memoir My Journey designer Donna Karan shares her life story, including intimate and candid stories of her difficult and isolated childhood (the daughter of a tailor and a showroom model-turned-Seventh Avenue saleswoman); her nearly five decades in an ever-evolving fashion industry; her two marriages; motherhood; and her spiritual journey over the last twenty years. Since she introduced her game-changing Seven Easy Pieces fashion collection in 1985 (which allowed working women to trade their manly suits for sensual, comfortable separates), she has never lost sight of her life goal: to empower women. In this, her first book, she interweaves the journey of her incredible career (from scrappy Anne Klein intern to lifestyle guru) with her personal ups and downs as a young woman plagued by insecurities, a wife and mother straddling the personal and the professional, and a spiritual seeker and philanthropist.
ShortDesc: In her new deeply personal and sometimes provocative memoir My Journey designer Donna Karan shares her life story.
Title: Donna Karan in Conversation

MobileDesc:
In partnership with Urban Word NYC and NYC Votes, 92Y presents the New York City Youth Poet Laureate Slam Finals to identify youth writers and leaders who are committed to youth voting, poetry and performance, and social justice issues across NYC. The event will showcase the top teen poets in NYC, as well as announce the 2015-16 NYC Youth Poet Laureate who will receive a book deal from Penmanship Books.

Learn more here
ShortDesc: In partnership with Urban Word NYC and NYC Votes, 92Y presents the New York City Youth Poet Laureate Slam Finals to identify youth writers and leaders who are committed to youth voting, poetry and performance, and social justice issues across NYC.
Title: New York City Youth Poet Laureate Competition

MobileDesc: Don Henley and Billy Joel, true American rock royalty, have remained friends throughout their careers. Joel even sang at Henley’s wedding, while Henley showed his admiration by performing at Joel’s Kennedy Center Honors. Now these two music legends are set to make a rare public appearance together, when Joel moderates a conversation with Henley at 92Y. Hear them talk about their lives, their careers and about Henley’s Cass County, his first solo album in 15 years, a musical return to his roots. Please join us for what promises to be a memorable evening.
ShortDesc: Don Henley, both as solo artist and as a member of the Eagles, has received many accolades, including eight GRAMMY Awards, numerous gold and platinum records and performed sold-out concert tours worldwide.
Title: Don Henley in Conversation with Billy Joel

MobileDesc: In today’s culture, the bonds of female friendship are taken as a given. But only a few centuries ago, the idea of female friendship was unacknowledged, as only men, it was assumed, had the emotional and intellectual depth to develop and sustain these meaningful relationships. Acclaimed historian Marilyn Yalom and co-author, Theresa Donovan Brown examine shifting attitudes towards female friendship in history, literature, philosophy, religion and pop culture to demonstrate how women have been able to co-opt the public face of friendship throughout the years.  Chronicling shifting attitudes toward friendship from the Bible and the Romans to the Enlightenment to the women’s rights movements of the ‘60s up to "Sex and the City" and Bridesmaids, they reveal how the concept of female friendship has been inextricably linked to the larger social and cultural movements that have defined human history.
ShortDesc: In today’s culture, the bonds of female friendship are taken as a given.
Title: The Social Sex: A Cultural History of Female Friendship from the Bible to Bridesmaids

MobileDesc: Photographer and vinyl champion Eilon Paz traveled around the world for 5 years from Brooklyn to West Africa interviewing record collectors in the most intimate of environments—their record rooms. Driven by his own passion for the medium, he interviewed everyone from Questlove to Gilles Peterson, finding out what motivates these collectors to keep digging for more records. This conversation, slideshow and listening party, will unearth the very soul of the vinyl community, getting up close and personal with DJs Sheila Burgel, Jeff “Chairman” Mao and Rich Medina, record producer Yale Evelev, and more in a celebration of passion and discovery and a tribute to the thriving spirit of vinyl aficionados across the globe.
ShortDesc: Photographer and vinyl champion Eilon Paz traveled around the world for 5 years from Brooklyn to West Africa interviewing record collectors in the most intimate of environments—their record rooms.
Title: Adventures in Record Collecting: a Conversation and Listening Party with Dust & Grooves

MobileDesc: Wed, Nov 11 - See Patton Oswalt discuss his bestselling memoir Silver Screen Fiend, about coming up as a comic in Los Angeles and being addicted to movies.
ShortDesc: Wed, Nov 11 - See Patton Oswalt discuss his bestselling memoir Silver Screen Fiend, about coming up as a comic in Los Angeles and being addicted to movies.
Title: A Conversation with Patton Oswalt

MobileDesc: The growth of ISIS, Russian aggression, the Iran deal, the controversial NSA—these are just some of the urgent national security challenges our next president will face. What steps will the White House need to take to ensure our safety? Hear two expert perspectives on these pressing issues when General David Petraeus, who led American forces in Iraq and Afghanistan, sits down with Vance Serchuk, former national security advisor to Senator Joe Lieberman. With the world in turmoil, what sort of leadership can we hope for?
ShortDesc: See General David Petraeus talk with Vance Serchuk, an adviser to Senator Joe Lieberman, about national security challenges and election 2016.
Title: General David Petraeus in Conversation with Vance Serchuk: National Security Challenges for the Next President

ShortDesc: Bullying-in school or on the Internet-is a traumatic experience for children, and many parents may not realize it's happening to their child.
Title: Recognizing Bullying

MobileDesc:
Irving Berlin, the Russian-born Jewish-American composer and lyricist, is widely considered one of the greatest songwriters in American history.

Enjoy some of Berlin’s most memorable songs, including “White Christmas,” “They Say It's Wonderful,” “Let’s Face The Music and Dance,” “Change Partners,” “Easter Parade,” and many more and hear inside stories from Harvey Granat and special guest Robert Kimball.

Harvey Granat manages to make the American Songbook come to life with his highly informative and entertaining series at the 92Y.”—Stephen Sorokoff, Times Square Chronicles
ShortDesc: Enjoy some of Irving Berlin’s most memorable songs, including “White Christmas,” while hearing inside stories from special guest Robert Kimball.
Title: A Special Irving Berlin Holiday Program: White Christmas and a Whole Lot More

MobileDesc:
Free Health Talk Presented by the Mount Sinai Health System.

One in four Americans suffer from a serious chronic or life-threatening respiratory disease, from asthma and emphysema to lung cancer and cystic fibrosis. Dr. Charles Powell of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai will address these complex respiratory illnesses and discuss advanced diagnostics and recognizing prevalent lung conditions.
ShortDesc: Learn more about your respiratory health—from asthma to emphysema—with Mount Sinai Health System’s doctor Charles Powell, MD.
Title: Respiratory Health: Diagnostics and Prevention

MobileDesc:
Free Health Talk Presented by the Mount Sinai Health System.

With diabetes being a leading cause of death in the United States and with more than 9% of Americans living with it, the need for awareness and education is as important as ever. Dr. Reshmi Srinath of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai will bring awareness to this condition by discussing the risk factors and prevention and treatment options.
ShortDesc: Learn about diabetes and take the first steps towards managing it, and living a longer, healthier life from Mount Sinai Health System's Reshmi Srinath, MD.
Title: Diabetes: Risk Factors, Prevention and Treatment Options

MobileDesc: Millions of people have been empowered by Amy Cuddy’s groundbreaking TED talk—the second most-viewed talk in the history of TED—on body language. The Harvard social psychologist’s research has been covered by NPR, The New York Times, Wired, Fast Company and more. She’s been named a Game Changer by Time, one of 50 Women Who Are Changing the World by Business Insider and a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum. Now she’s publishing her first book—Presence: Bringing Your Boldest Self to Your Biggest Challenges, in which she explains the science underlying mind-body effects such as ‘power posing,’ and teaches us how to use this science to become self-assured in high pressure moments—job interviews, difficult conversations, speaking up for ourselves and more. She’ll talk with Susan Cain, bestselling author of Quiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can’t Stop Talking.
ShortDesc: Millions of people have been empowered by Amy Cuddy’s groundbreaking TED talk—the second most-viewed talk in the history of TED—on body language.
Title: Amy Cuddy with Susan Cain: On Presence and Power

MobileDesc: On July 10, 1941, the citizens of Jedwabne rounded up the Jewish population and burned them alive. Part history, part memoir, this is the story of the massacre told through oral histories of survivors and witnesses, and a portrait of a Polish town coming to terms with its dark past.
ShortDesc: Understand the massacre of Jews in wartime Jedwabne through the stories of survivors and witnesses, as retold by journalist and author Anna Bikont.
Title: The Crime and the Silence

ShortDesc: Each year, a unique event takes place to celebrate & accelerate the global advancement of women ... the advancement of YOU.
Title: S.H.E. Summit: 2-Day Package

ShortDesc: For more than 15 years, 92Y audiences have relished the clarity and thoughtfulness Professor Ralph Buultjens brings to discussions of foreign affairs.
Title: World Politics with Ralph Buultjens
